  • Confidence without arrogance: You are confident but not arrogant. You ask for help when needed and openly admit when you don‚Äôt know something. You value and celebrate the contributions of others.
  • Exceptional communication skills: You explain your ideas clearly and succinctly, ask for input, and listen carefully. You build on the ideas of others, and your presentations are impactful without being overwhelming.
  • Transparency: You value transparency, always willing to share your knowledge and ideas with the team.
  • Team collaboration: You are a strong team player, supporting and collaborating with others to achieve common goals.

What do we offer?

  • Joining a dynamic and agile company undergoing international expansion.
  • Working in start-up mode with the support of the Santander Group.
  • Competitive remuneration and attractive benefits package.
  • Possibility of growth within the company and the Group.
  • Collaborating on international projects in different countries.
  • Excellent work environment, social clubs and frequent events.

Would you like to grow with us? Join our team!

Openbank is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered as equal without paying attention to gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, age, political orientation, union membership nor disability status.

We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify, and build.

The personal data you provide as well as any data generated during the selection process are confidential and will be processed by Open Bank, S.A./ Open Digital Services, S.L. with registered office at Plaza de Santa B√°rbara 2, 28004 (Madrid), for the sole purpose of managing your participation in the selection processes and, where appropriate, to formalise your recruitment.‚ÄØ

For further information about your rights and data protection, please read the ODS/Openbank Privacy Policy applicable to this type of data processing here.‚ÄØ

#OPENBANK

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: Junior Data Analyst




Location: Madrid




On-board time: ASAP




About us




We are a technology company, driven by the passion to create the ultimate products, with smart terminals and intelligent services at its core. Founded over 20 years ago, with headquarters in Dongguan, China, we are proud to say that we still have over 80-percent of employees working in R&D, as part of our proprietary research and development system. By now, we have over 300 million active users worldwide, and we are ranked 5th in global market share.







One dream. One team




Holding a firm belief in creating the vivo culture in Europe, we are proud to say that our team is courageous, ambitious, authentic and multicultural with 15 nationalities and growing. We celebrate each nationalities' special day. At vivo, we make sure your voice is heard, and your culture is respected.




At vivo, we commit ourselves to one thing, do the right things and do things right. We support openness and authenticity, promote self-reflection and continuous learning, we thrive to provide a working environment where our talents can perform at their peak.







In a few words




We are seeking a passionate (Junior) Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The successful candidate will support data-driven projects by providing data analysis, assisting with report automation, and participating in the optimization of data systems, thereby supporting strategic decision-making across various departments.




This role will contribute to enhancing organizational efficiency through cross-functional collaboration and data handling.







Your Challenges:




Data Operations & Analysis:

Assist in designing, developing, and maintaining data workflows, utilizing tools like Python, R, or Power Automate to improve efficiency.
Create and maintain Power BI dashboards, applying DAX for data analysis to provide clear insights for cross-functional teams.
Support data management for the Purchase, Sales, Inventory (PSI) system, assisting in enhancing real-time tracking and decision-making capabilities for the Spanish market.
Participate in Profit & Loss (P&L) analysis and market analysis, providing data support for the Spanish business to optimize financial performance.
Assist in developing and implementing solutions to automate reporting processes, reducing manual effort.

Forecasting & Strategic Insights:

Integrate market strategy information, retail-related data, and sales forecasts to assist in the analysis of promotion plans, providing data input for business decisions in the Spanish market.
Prepare daily sales reports and participate in the creation of weekly sales analysis and market reports, identifying key trends, brand performance, and pricing information to support strategic planning.

Collaboration & Communication:

Collaborate closely with retail, sales, and finance teams in Spain to understand data needs and provide corresponding data support.
Clearly explain data findings and basic technical concepts to stakeholders from various backgrounds.







Your profile includes:







Background:

Background in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or related fields, with programming and quantitative analysis capabilities.
Recent graduates (with at least 6-12 months of relevant internship experience) or candidates with 1+ years of experience as a Junior Data Analyst are welcome to apply.
Proven experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard development using Excel and Power BI.

Portfolio (Highly Recommended):

A portfolio demonstrating relevant projects (e.g., GitHub profile, Power BI dashboard examples) is a strong plus.

Technical Skills:

Core Skills:
Proficient in Python and R, with the ability to independently perform data cleaning, processing, and analysis.
Proficient in Power BI for data visualization and dashboard creation, with an understanding of DAX application.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, including Power Query (data cleaning), Power Pivot (data modeling), and Cube Functions (data retrieval).
Understanding of the basic concepts of Microsoft Power Platform (especially Power Automate).
Preferred Skills:
Experience using Python or R for data integration and workflow automation is preferred.
Basic understanding of data system optimization and real-time tracking frameworks.

Communication & Collaboration Skills:

Possess a strong team spirit and the ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Good written and verbal communication skills, capable of presenting data findings clearly.

Language Proficiency:

Mandarin Chinese: Fluent
Spanish: Business proficiency.
English: Business proficiency.

Interview Process Note:

Please note that a case study may be required as part of the interview process.







What we offer?




We work hard to ensure that every employee feels supported and encouraged to have a healthy balance between health, work and home commitments. We believe a balanced and healthy life outside of the office makes for a happier, healthier future together.




At vivo, we are committed to providing equal opportunities. We value diversity and inclusion and do not discriminate against people on any basis, such as, but not limited to, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation or disability. We focus on doing the right thing and do things right! We look forward to hearing back from you!







Connect with us!




If this sounds like your next challenge, send us your application at this link

Title: Analyst, Analytics & Insights Delivery
Description:
Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose ‚Äì to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.



Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.





Job Description



The Global Business Optimisation team has a simple mission: we turn massive amounts of data into actionable insights that drive business value. Our analytic consultants and data analysts work with Visa‚Äôs clients, partners, and staff to improve portfolio performance, program profitability, and cardholder experiences. By coupling in-depth analysis of cardholder behaviour with Visa‚Äôs world-class products, digital offerings, and marketing capabilities, we ensure our clients‚Äô programs operate at their peak potential and that cardholders have seamless commerce experiences in both the physical and digital world.



As part of the Client Services organisation, this role will take ownership of this vision and deliver with excellence for our organisation and our clients. The successful candidate will use strong big data and analytical skills, contextual business sense, and a creative flair to solve real-world business challenges for Visa issuing banks, acquirers, merchants, and processors. In addition, your analytic expertise will directly impact the strategic direction of the organisation and how we deliver value from our data assets.



The successful candidate will be a key member in Global Business Optimisation, within Client Services, supporting all aspects of improving and optimising payment success, including but not exclusive to authentication and authorisation. Responsible for building and deploying a single source of truth on insights, facts, and reporting related to the Visa Europe Regions payment processing.



Responsibilities



Assist other team members in deriving analytic insights on client performance and deliver findings to external and internal stakeholders, by proactively advising on how to improve performance.
Formulate and source necessary datasets from internal tools and platforms, rendering insights in compelling presentations and visualizations.
Create and present analytic deliverables to external Visa clients, colleagues in the analytics team, and other internal stakeholders with varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise.
Develop specific knowledge on authentication and/or authorisation, with active monitoring and client meetings to help them improve and optimise performance.
Identify and understand the root cause of problems, define analytical objectives, and formalise data requirements for various types of analyses.
Combine and analyse disparate data sources and derive insights in a Big Data environment.
Work with a pan-European team located in multiple locations and contribute to global projects.
Proactively facilitate the overall analytic delivery strategy for the organisation.
Compare client performance against industry best practices to identify performance and/or profitability improvement opportunities.
Present complex data and content to clients in an accurate, understandable, and engaging manner, considering stakeholders' varying degrees of analytical and technical expertise by translating analysis and insights into stakeholder & client language.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.





Qualifications



2+ years of working experience in a corporate environment.
Visa experience or knowledge of the payments industry is highly preferable.
Knowledge of the Authorisation/ Authentication process is highly preferable.
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills required.
Proven client presentation skills.
Proactive, curious, problem solver with experience of being a self-starter and a willingness to learn.
Experience working in data analysis and/or insight delivery with a proven record of creating business value from data.
Basic level of manipulating data from a variety of sources - Big data skills (Hadoop, Hive, Spark) and/or SQL skills is an advantage.
Experience visualizing data with tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Must be proficient in all MS Office applications with advanced Excel spreadsheet skills.
Excellent spoken and written command of English.
Knowledge of additional European language(s) is an advantage.





Additional Information



Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Analyst (SQL) - Madrid
Description:
Lo que buscamos es‚Ä¶




En Garaje buscamos un Data Analyst con al menos 3 a√±os de experiencia en labores de an√°lisis de datos con el objetivo de trabajar en colaboraci√≥n con equipo de analistas para impulsar el negocio de uno de nuestros principales clientes dentro del sector energ√≠a. Queremos incorporar un perfil con conocimiento avanzado en lenguajes de procesamiento de datos (SQL) y desarrollo en Python que adem√°s aporte experiencia en la extracci√≥n de insights.




Y en concreto, esto es lo que har√°s:




Dise√±ar y redactar queries SQL para que las ejecute el equipo con acceso a datos
Trasladar los requerimientos y KPIs a nivel negocio a informes de f√°cil consumo por los principales stakeholders de la compa√±√≠a
Definir y documentar KPIs alineados con objetivos de negocio
Generar extracciones de datos para el seguimiento diario a trav√©s de herramientas como Excel
Validar resultados y detectar errores o inconsistencias en los datos entregados
Extraer insights relevantes a partir del an√°lisis de los funnels de conversi√≥n y segmentando
Crear visualizaciones b√°sicas/intermedias con herramientas ligeras (Excel, Python, etc.)
Especificar l√≥gica de transformaci√≥n de datos para procesos ETL.
Proponer mejoras en m√©tricas y estructuras de datos.
Colaborar con distintos equipos (datos, negocio, producto) para resolver necesidades anal√≠ticas
Identificar patrones o desviaciones en los indicadores clave.




Para eso, necesitamos que tengas‚Ä¶




Conocimiento avanzado en SQL & DBT
Conocimiento en proyectos para desarrollo con Python
Conocimiento avanzado en Excel
Grandes capacidades comunicativas, facilitando as√≠ la comprensi√≥n de los datos a stakeholders de diferentes √°reas dentro de una compa√±√≠a
Experiencia en la explotaci√≥n de informaci√≥n desde herramientas de Big Data como Google BigQuery
Valorable experiencias previas en la explotaci√≥n de dashboards como Power BI
Capacidades demostrables en la generaci√≥n de informes y reports de alto nivel para las compa√±√≠as
Experiencias previas en la explotaci√≥n de datos a trav√©s de herramientas de marketing (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics‚Ä¶ )




En Garaje nos gustan las personas que‚Ä¶




Se enorgullecen de su trabajo, dan lo mejor de s√≠ mismas, se divierten siempre, son valientes y se arriesgan, aprenden de los errores y aman lo que hacen.

Nuestra actitud se define por la pasi√≥n con la que nos involucramos en nuestros proyectos, la empat√≠a y cercan√≠a que mostramos hacia nuestros clientes, y nuestra ambici√≥n de ir m√°s all√° de lo correcto.




En Garaje...Somos | No somos:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description



We‚Äôre looking for a Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are
At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionize digital advertising.

Your Challenge

You will propose a new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding.
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasping the attention of the public and transmitting complex information into simple explanations.
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients.
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc).
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales to marketing to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day.
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze the performance of our current Contextual products and actively propose improvements together with the Product Team.
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics-related field.
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field.
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must.
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative solutions.
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English.
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment.
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills.
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment.
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!
It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.

Why Join Seedtag?
Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.
Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO and optional English or Spanish group classes.
Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.
Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company off-sites, and more!

Additional Perks
Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage is included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV, and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process, and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include


Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
Renewable technology supplier leaderboards


Responsibilities


Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements


About You


At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values

  • Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
  • Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
  • Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
  • Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
  • Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Wood Mackenzie‚Äôs Power and Renewables Data team.

This role will focus on the analysis, programmatic acquisition, and preparation of data for delivery to our customers and research teams.

Wood Mackenzie Produces Research And Data That The Energy Industry Relies On To Understand And Navigate The Energy Transition. Examples Of Products That You Will Contribute To Include

  • Power supply and demand long-term outlooks
  • Power market pricing history and long-term outlooks
  • Renewable technology supplier leaderboards

Responsibilities

  • Own the quality and delivery timeline of critical datasets
  • Obtain, transform, and deliver information from our databases to support industry analysis using Excel, PowerQuery, PowerBI, GraphQL, SQL, Sisense, Python, and Snowflake
  • Create and maintain workflows for internal stakeholders
  • Create and maintain data pipelines to feed customer facing products
  • Identify and assess opportunities for optimization of our systems, processes, and datasets
  • Monitor and resolve alerts in production environments to preserve the integrity of our products
  • Identify internal and external sources of data that will support customer needs
  • Collaborate with colleagues across multiple time zones and disciplines to uncover pain points, process improvements, and product requirements

About You

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data analyst or data engineering role
  • Experience working in environments reliant on SQL, Python, and Snowflake
  • Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration
  • Hands on approach to problem solving that delves into the details while maintaining the ability to succinctly propose solutions to steer management decisions
  • Independently completes projects given time and platform constraints
  • Desire to play a key role in the energy transition by delivering the data and research that catalyzes progress
  • Intellectual curiosity about the provenance of data and journey it makes to arrive at a destination
  • Passionate ownership of projects and excitement to share accomplishments with fellow Woodmackers
  • Preferred: Experience in the energy industry or power modelling domain
  • Fluent in English. Bonus language skills: Mandarin, Spanish

Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server )
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.


At Finsolutia, we evaluate all candidates in a fair and equitable manner, ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates, based solely on the skills, experience, and competencies required for the position. No candidate in this process will be discriminated against based on race, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, or any other personal characteristic. Our commitment is to ensure an inclusive environment and equal opportunities for all candidates.

Para su conocimiento le informamos que los datos personales recogidos por esta v√≠a se destinar√°n √∫nica y exclusivamente, a la gesti√≥n profesional del proceso de reclutamiento en cuesti√≥n y ser√°n procesados y almacenados por Finsolutia Spain SLU, en conformidad con lo dispuesto en el Reglamento (UE) 2016/679 de 27 de abril de 2016. Esta informaci√≥n se conservar√° por un plazo m√°ximo de 4 a√±os en caso de participar en alg√∫n proceso de selecci√≥n. Le informamos que puede oponerse en cualquier momento al almacenamiento y tratamiento de sus datos, as√≠ como revocar el consentimiento prestado y ejercitar los derechos de acceso, rectificaci√≥n y cancelaci√≥n, en los t√©rminos previstos en la normativa aplicable. Para ejercitar estos derechos puede dirigirse personalmente o por correo postal, adjuntando fotocopia del DNI a Recruitment Department: Finsolutia Spain, SLU ‚Äì c/Cardenal Marcelo Sp√≠nola 14, 4 planta, 28016. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wood Mackenzie is the global data and analytics business for the renewables, energy, and natural resources industries. Enhanced by technology. Enriched by human intelligence. In an ever-changing world, companies and governments need reliable and actionable insight to lead the transition to a sustainable future. That‚Äôs why we cover the entire supply chain with unparalleled breadth and depth, backed by over 50 years‚Äô experience. Our team of over 2,400 experts, operating across 30 global locations, are enabling customers‚Äô decisions through real-time analytics, consultancy, events and thought leadership. Together, we deliver the insight they need to separate risk from opportunity and make confident decisions when it matters most.

WoodMac.com

Wood Mackenzie Brand Video

Wood Mackenzie Values


Inclusive ‚Äì we succeed together
Trusting ‚Äì we choose to trust each other
Customer committed ‚Äì we put customers at the heart of our decisions
Future Focused ‚Äì we accelerate change
Curious ‚Äì we turn knowledge into action


Role Purpose

The Data Analyst will play a key role in advancing forecasting and modelling efforts by managing, analysing, and optimising large datasets across renewable, conventional, and storage assets globally. Working on asset revenue forecasting, power dispatch modelling, or power markets data, the analyst will focus on automating workflows, ensuring data quality, and delivering actionable insights through close collaboration with research, engineering, and product teams. This role contributes directly to improving forecasting accuracy and enhancing the company's global asset performance and revenue strategies.

Responsibilities

Knowledge


Structures poorly defined problems, gathers feedback, and solves them effectively.
Defines hypotheses and appropriate analysis approaches.
Ensures statistical validity of results while avoiding common pitfalls.
Develops deep technical expertise and emerging domain knowledge in forecasting or dispatch modelling.
Provides specialist skills in data analysis, visualisation, and data management.
Fully understands the technical data landscape within the energy domain.
Maintains a growth mindset, continually evolving their skills.


Impact


Performs defined and repeatable tasks with limited guidance.
Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.


Collaboration


Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.


Innovation


Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.


Specialisms

General


Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.


Data Modelling


Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.


Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).


Technical Skills


Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.


Soft Skills


Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.


Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

  • Independently formulates new analyses and project components.
  • Carries out independent analysis on specific areas of forecasting or modelling projects.
  • Delivers high-quality outputs on time, recognised for accuracy and reliability.
  • Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL or Python for data handling.

Collaboration

  • Supports data governance and quality assurance activities.
  • Engages directly with stakeholders, building confidence in data-driven outcomes.
  • Works closely with peers in Research, Product, Data, Data Engineering, and other business functions.

Innovation

  • Identifies opportunities for efficiency, optimisation, or new data creation within their focus area.
  • Uses technical and domain knowledge to create new value and insights.

Specialisms

General

  • Owns and manages data within their role or team focus.
  • Leverages specialist toolsets or domain expertise for data analysis and decision-making.

Data Modelling

  • Applies best practices in data modelling to support use cases.
  • Translates data requirements into effective data structures.
  • Collaborates with engineers to enhance data modelling capabilities for large-scale datasets.

Key Expectations

Experience & Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data analysis, including handling large, complex datasets.
  • Advanced SQL skills for querying and managing relational databases.
  • Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Sisense, Power BI, Streamlit).

Technical Skills

  • Experience with ETL processes and APIs for data integration.
  • Understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms like Snowflake is advantageous.
  • Knowledge of data governance frameworks and data security protocols.

Soft Skills

  • Exceptional attention to detail and problem-solving capabilities.
  • Strong communication skills, able to translate complex insights for non-technical stakeholders.
  • Collaborative mindset with a commitment to continuous learning and staying updated on energy sector trends.

Equal Opportunities

We are an equal opportunities employer. This means we are committed to recruiting the best people regardless of their race, colour, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. You can find out more about your rights under the law at www.eeoc.gov

If you are applying for a role and have a physical or mental disability, we will support you with your application or through the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Thank you for your interest in working for our Company. Recruiting the right talent is crucial to our goals. On April 1, 2024, 3M Healthcare underwent a corporate spin-off leading to the creation of a new company named Solventum. We are still in the process of updating our Careers Page and applicant documents, which currently have 3M branding. Please bear with us. In the interim, our Privacy Policy here: https://www.solventum.com/en-us/home/legal/website-privacy-statement/applicant-privacy/ continues to apply to any personal information you submit, and the 3M-branded positions listed on our Careers Page are for Solventum positions. As it was with 3M, at Solventum all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Description

3M Health Care is now Solventum

At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customers‚Äô toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.

We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.

The Impact You‚Äôll Make in this Role

As a Data Analyst (m/f/*) In The EMEA DS Sales Excellence Team, You Will Have The Opportunity To Tap Into Your Curiosity And Collaborate With Some Of The Most Innovative And Diverse People Around The World. Here, You Will Make An Impact By


EMEA DS data analysis including internal data and external raw data to provide data-based insights to drive growth and increase share of wallet
Advanced Analytics: Perform complex data analysis using Power BI's DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query to deliver actionable insights
SQL Expertise: Write complex SQL queries for data extraction and transformation. Work closely with data engineers to ensure efficient data pipelines are in place.
Snowflake Integration: Work with Snowflake databases for data storage, retrieval, and transformation. Optimize SQL queries to efficiently extract and manipulate data within Snowflake.
Power BI Security Model: Implement and manage Power BI security configurations such as row-level security (RLS) to ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Collaboration & Communication: Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand reporting needs and translate them into actionable Power BI solutions.
Data Quality & Integrity: Ensure high-quality, accurate, and consistent data by performing data validation and quality checks.
Performance Optimization: Optimize Power BI reports and dashboards for faster load times and overall better performance.
Documentation & Training: Create and maintain documentation for Power BI dashboards, data models, and security configurations. Train end-users on the use of Power BI reports and features.


Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, Solventum requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field
Profound experience in Power BI development and analytics
Profound experience in Power BI or BI Tool‚Äôs development with proven experience in building dashboards and reports from scratch
Proficiency in SQL, Snowflake, Power BI Desktop, Power BI Service, and related tools such as Power Query and DAX for advanced calculations
Experience with advanced analytics techniques such as predictive modeling, statistical analysis, or machine learning integration into Power BI
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience working with large data sets
Knowledge of data visualization best practices to ensure clarity and usability of reports and dashboards
Strong attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines


Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status.

Supporting Your Well-being

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life ‚Äì both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Diversity & Inclusion

(*) We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, civil status, disability, family status, or membership of the travelling community.

Solventum is committed to maintaining the highest standards of integrity and professionalism in our recruitment process. Applicants must remain alert to fraudulent job postings and recruitment schemes that falsely claim to represent Solventum and seek to exploit job seekers.

Please note that all email communications from Solventum regarding job opportunities with the company will be from an email with a domain of @solventum.com. Be wary of unsolicited emails or messages regarding Solventum job opportunities from emails with other email domains.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

Solventum Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at Solventum are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the

terms.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Contact Center Operations
Description:
Company Description

At MSX International, a North American multinational and leading consultancy for the automotive industry, we have over 500 experts in Spain and Portugal dedicated to developing and implementing innovative solutions that enhance our clients' business processes and outcomes.

With more than 25 years of industry experience, our multilingual and multicultural Contact Center operates with a proactive and dynamic approach. Our diverse team consistently contributes ideas, makes informed decisions, and collaborates to ensure each client feels unique and fully satisfied with our exceptional service.

Today, our team comprises over 170 professionals, and thanks to our commitment to excellence, we continue to grow!

Job Description

Do you have a passion for data analytics and making sense of complex information?

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our team and support our Contact Center operations. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain data models and dashboards, delivering actionable insights into customer data. This technical position is key to driving decision-making and identifying new opportunities to enhance performance.

Key Responsibilities


Design and develop KPI dashboards to enhance decision-making and performance tracking.
Leverage data mining techniques and reporting tools to create insightful reports and dashboards.
Prepare analytics reports in a clear and professional presentation format.
Collaborate on establishing effective data ETL practices and processes.
Conduct research and analyze ad-hoc studies as required.
Document process flows and business rules, ensuring up-to-date and accurate records.
Process and analyze large datasets, keeping current reports updated and relevant.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
1-3 years of experience in fast-paced industries like automotive or similar businesses preferred.
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Proficiency in SQL for querying relational databases.
Expertise in data manipulation, complex analysis, and statistical modeling.
Excellent analytical skills to interpret and communicate data insights effectively.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with ETL tools (e.g., SSIS, Alteryx, KNIME).
Familiarity with Training, Learning, Development, or Talent Management teams.
Strong multitasking, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented with a proactive and solutions-driven mindset.
Full professional proficiency in English is required.
Ability to perform advanced statistical analysis.


Additional Information

What we offer:


Be part of a great team of professionals in an internationally consolidated company.
MSX Bazaar: A collective purchasing portal with fantastic discounts for employees.
The possibility to join the Flexible Compensation Plan (including medical insurance, transport card, meal card, training, and more).
23 working days of vacation per year, as stipulated by the collective agreement.
Additional incentives such as employee referral programs, opportunities as internal trainers, recognition for new business contributions, and more.
You will be working from our Madrid office in a 50% hybrid position, with the first 5-6 months approx. fully on-site for the adaptation period. Our office is located at C. de Albasanz, 15, San Blas-Canillejas, 28037 Madrid.
Salary: ‚Ç¨30,000 gross per year.


MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Title: Data Analyst/ Data Management
Description:
Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst/ Data Management professional with 8 to 11 years of experience. The ideal candidate will have expertise in Azure Conversational Language AWS CodePipeline AWS CodeDeploy AWS CodeCommit and AWS CodeBuild. This hybrid role requires a strong technical background and the ability to manage data effectively. The position operates during the day shift and does not require travel.

Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex data sets to identify patterns and trends.
Develop and maintain data management systems to ensure data integrity and security.
Utilize Azure Conversational Language to enhance data processing and analysis.
Implement and manage AWS CodePipeline for continuous integration and delivery.
Oversee AWS CodeDeploy to automate application deployments.
Manage AWS CodeCommit repositories to ensure efficient version control.
Utilize AWS CodeBuild to automate the build process.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze data requirements.
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support business decisions.
Ensure data quality and consistency across various data sources.
Create and maintain documentation for data management processes and procedures.
Monitor data management systems to identify and resolve issues promptly.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to improve data management practices.


Qualifications


Possess strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Demonstrate proficiency in Azure Conversational Language.
Have hands-on experience with AWS CodePipeline AWS CodeDeploy AWS CodeCommit and AWS CodeBuild.
Exhibit excellent problem-solving abilities.
Show strong communication and collaboration skills.
Have a solid understanding of data management principles.
Be able to work independently and as part of a team.
Display a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related issues.
Hold a relevant certification in AWS or Azure technologies.
Demonstrate the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Show a commitment to continuous learning and professional development.
Have a strong understanding of data security and privacy regulations.
Be able to adapt to a hybrid work model and manage time effectively.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
üéØ Your mission

We are looking for a top-class Data Analyst to become part of our Partner Lifecycle team. This role will help the team better understand opportunities to activate and engage users, as well as enable senior stakeholders to understand the impact of the campaigns and make some of the most important decisions to ensure the long-term success of Playtomic. If you‚Äôre someone that enjoys challenges and building things from the ground up, this is the role for you!

üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª What you‚Äôll be doing


Provide internal stakeholders support on all data related queries, including verifying data quality, analyzing data, isolating and diagnosing problems and resolving issues.
Be a key part of the Partner Lifecycle team.
Assist in designing and analyzing experiments (A/B testing, dif. in dif. etc.).
Design, publish and maintain Looker dashboards and visualization tools to facilitate campaign optimization and stakeholder reporting.
Conduct exploratory analysis and translate insights into quantifiable business opportunities.
Analyze and interpret CRM data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform strategic decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable data-driven insights.
Ensure seamless integration of data into Braze for targeted and personalized messaging.



ü¶Ñ Our Ideal Player


3+ years work experience in data analysis, engineering or other technical positions.
BS/MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics or other disciplines with demonstrated technical exposure.
Strong analytical mindset to deliver effective & pragmatic solutions.
Strong SQL skills - able to extract, manipulate, transform and analyze large volumes of data with a high level of accuracy.
Excellent communication, visualization & storytelling with data skills to both scientific and business audiences.
Outstanding attention to detail - you are methodical and thorough in your analyses (problem statement, data discovery to result communication).
Strong understanding of incrementality testing across multiple platforms.
Native/Fluent Spanish and proficient English



ü§ì Extra points:


A strong grasp of statistical concepts, especially those related to experiment design and analysis.
Good knowledge of BigQuery.
Certification in Braze or equivalent CRM platforms
Located in Barcelona/Madrid and love racket sports!


ü§ù What‚Äôs in it for you


Salary: Depending on experience, to be discussed in the People Team Interview
23 days of vacation + day off on your birthday + 2 days off for Wellness days in August.
1 additional day off per year worked.
Hybrid / Remote work.
Flexibility to attend team-building events.
Social benefits (63‚Ç¨ a month in one of these: health insurance/tickets restaurant), flexible spending (pre-tax) in training, kindergarten, and transportation.
Gympass discount
Perks related to the brand and our sponsorship agreements
Summer work schedule (July-August 7h/day Monday to Friday)



‚û°Ô∏è Our hiring process

Last, and for you to start warming up, we want to show you what our process looks like:


First Interview - with our Head of Partner Lifecycle
People Interview - Cultural fit in Playtomic, to define the conditions of our offer
Technical Interview - with a team member from Data
Final Interview with stakeholders from the Partner Development team



About Us üéæ

We are the world‚Äôs largest racket sports App for players and clubs. Our goal is to socialize sports practice: through the app, players can book courts, find other players with similar skill levels, and join a social community dedicated to playing. Since 2017, Playtomic has earned the trust of national and international investors, consolidating it as one of the main world players in sports digitalization., You will find 200+ co-workers around the world with headquarters in Spain and offices in Italy, Portugal, Sweden, Finland, Belgium, UK, EEUU and Mexico.

Take a look to our candidate playbook!

Title: Data Analyst with Tableau
Description:
Looking for a company that challenges you every day?


At ERNI, you will have the opportunity to develop customized software solutions that have an actual impact on people life‚Äôs and on the society. Therefore, you will be dealing with concepts like sophistication, quality, complexity and/or regulations.

Our leadership in the Health-Tech (Diagnostic Medical Devices, Pharma, Health Care‚Ä¶) and in all industries around Smart Devices (Robots, Cars, 3D Printers, Machinery‚Ä¶), in a powerful combination with the way we growth people, let us create a growing, learning and challenging set up for ERNIans.

We build digital solutions that connect the physical world (devices & connectivity) with the digital one (software solutions embedded, connected, or consuming their data). You will be part of teams prioritizing the software lifecycle & ensuring that our code is both clean and secure. Our maturity in building high-impact software solutions approaches us whatever industry looking for quality and sophistication (e.g. Gaming, FMCG or Validation & Inspection..).

If this sounds interesting for you and you are ready to boost your skills in Data. Join our project in the Pharma sector to work on the development of¬†a¬†solution that enables managing and organizing data and processes to facilitate collaboration and compliant access to data.




How ERNI cares about YOU¬†

üìöPaid and rewarded certifications: you will be able to learn new technologies to develop as a professional in the areas that interest you most (such as: Agile, DevOps, Cloud, QA, etc.) and be rewarded from 200‚Ç¨ to 1.400‚Ç¨ per certification, in addition to the paid exam.¬†

üèÜHigh Value Training: after a year at ERNI, you will have the opportunity to enroll on +500‚Ç¨ Executive courses, Masters or Postgraduates. 80% of the total amount will be covered by the company.¬†

üëåHybrid working model: at ERNI we believe in the importance of building strong relationships with our colleagues, projects and customers. We believe that building these relationships is much more effective when done in person.¬†

üè†Home Office: you will receive an extra monthly compensation to cover your teleworking expenses, as well as any necessary equipment to be comfortable doing your job.¬†

üåçFar Home Office: you can extend your holidays and work remotely from any European country or Spanish city up to 5 weeks per year.¬†

üí´Flexible working shift*: you will enjoy a Friday intensive shift and a self-managed flexible working hours.¬†

ü§ùPermanent contract: there is always a project for you to keep working with us, you will always find a project that fits your expectations in our people allocation meetings.¬†

üöÄChallenging projects: ERNI is dedicated to develop high-quality software in complex technical environments such as pharmaceutics, biotechnology, robotics and 4.0 industry. With us, you will have the chance to participate in a variety of technical challenging projects amongst passionate and skilled colleagues.¬†

¬†üë®‚ÄçüéìTechnical trainings with our Experts: You will have the possibility to request unlimited one-to-one sessions with a technical subject expert, where you will have the opportunity to ask about new technologies, level up your expertise in any technical field, to learn specific topics or more advanced topics like how to change your technical career from one technology to another.

‚≠êProximity and support:¬†from the first day at ERNI, you will be guided by a Mentor and a People Development team that will make sure you have the right tools to develop and give you opportunities to grow in a project or to switch to a new one. You will also be able to count with the support of a Godparent who will guide and assist you with anything you need. You can ask them any questions or concerns you have about your daily activities.

üëÇCommunication: you will find transparency, honesty, and open communication all over the organization through a breakfast with our MD and a monthly session to be updated on what‚Äôs going on at ERNI.¬†

üèÖPromotions & Recognition: from the very first day, we offer you a way to learn and develop yourself in our company. All efforts are always recognized and appreciated by your colleagues and superiors which makes feel satisfied with your own achievements.


üéâ5 and 10 years at ERNI: we would want to celebrate two important milestones on your ERNI journey, your 5th and 10th anniversary with a celebration where all your colleagues will share some words of thanks. On the 5th anniversary, you will receive a special package at home, a restaurant voucher for two, and 3,000‚Ç¨ on your monthly payroll. For the 10th anniversary, you will receive 7,000‚Ç¨ on your monthly payroll, a special package at home and a gateway for two.¬†

üí≠Free languages courses: learn German and Spanish or improve your English skills with our external teachers in small groups once per week.¬†

ü©∫Private medical insurance: we will offer you a private medical insurance for you and a 100% salary coverage on sickness leave.¬†

üíäSickness leave: ERNI is with you during tough moments by offering 100% salary coverage during sickness leave. Moreover, if you feel sick one day, there is no need to go to the doctor and get sickness leave for that specific day because ERNI also covers you with the salary.

üçºMaternity and paternity leave: We support you and your family with 16 weeks of maternity and paternity leave.

üí∞Flexible compensation: you will be able to dedicate part of your gross salary to different options such as transportation bonus, ticket restaurant, kindergarten bonus and to also to be able to add a family member into your own insurance plan.¬†

ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èWorkout Benefit: We are committed to promote a healthy lifestyle and increase the well-being of each ERNIan, so you will have special discounts on fitness facilities and we will compensate 12‚Ç¨ per month who presents an invoice for any sport-related activity (dance classes, padel lessons, etc.).

‚úàÔ∏èRe-allocation funding: if you are coming from abroad, we will help to become a part of our company with a relocation package bonus from 1.000‚Ç¨ to 2.000‚Ç¨.¬†

ü§ëReferral program: you will receive an extra bonus with our ‚ÄúCandidate‚Äôs referral program‚Äù from 2.000‚Ç¨ to 6.000‚Ç¨ depending on the candidate seniority level; and an extra bonus, also with our ‚ÄúBusiness opportunity referral program‚Äù from 500‚Ç¨ to 5.000‚Ç¨ depending on the opportunity size and customer.¬†

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èLife support: to strengthen our commitment to conciliation and willingness of being close in your day-to-day life and important moments. We provide you a set of services and benefits, free of charge for, to assist you and your family in legal consultation, personal assistance, etc.¬†

üíÉEvents: we do believe in the importance of meeting our colleagues in an informal and natural environment to build connections and foster trust so that we feel like home. Leisure events, Christmas dinner and summer party are waiting for you!

üèñÔ∏èHolidays: You will have 23 vacation days per year to enjoy resting, with your family or friends.

¬†

To be a best fit for this project you will need:

Over 3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.

Proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and analysis.

Experience with Tableau for data visualization and reporting.

Familiarity with AWS is a plus.

Knowledge of ETL processes and tools.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

High level of English, written & spoken.

¬†

You will be responsible for:

Utilizing SQL for various data analysis tasks. This includes writing queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data effectively.
Managing databases efficiently to ensure data integrity and accessibility for analysis purposes.
Leveraging tools like Tableau to perform in-depth data analysis tasks, including data extraction, manipulation, and visualization to derive actionable insights.
Demonstrating a strong problem-solving mindset and the ability to troubleshoot and debug issues that may arise during the data analysis process.
Identifying and resolving errors in data, optimizing performance of data processes, and ensuring data accuracy throughout the analysis lifecycle.

We value diversity not only in terms of gender but also nationality, background, and skills. This diversity enriches our teams and allows us to create better solutions for our clients.¬†Every employee at ERNI has an equal opportunity to succeed.¬†Learn more about our initiatives¬†üîé:

Diversity and inclusion

Are you still curious? Discover what it is to become part of ERNI:

Careers at ERNI | Work with Us (betterask.erni)

Also, if yo want to know what¬†makes ERNI unique through the eyes of those who know it best üòé Take a look at this video:

ERNI in One Word - YouTube

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master‚Äôs degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Junior Consultant BI
Description:
¬øTe imaginas participando en la transformaci√≥n de las principales organizaciones nacionales e internacionales?

En Deloitte estamos comprometidos con generar un impacto en la sociedad, en nuestros clientes y en ti.

¬øCu√°l es el reto?

Nuestra pr√°ctica tecnol√≥gica, se enfoca en ayudar a nuestros clientes en la optimizaci√≥n de sus procesos de negocio e incrementar la eficiencia de su organizaci√≥n (ERP), impulsar una relaci√≥n efectiva con sus clientes (CRM) y visualizar datos de su organizaci√≥n desde un prisma m√°s √°gil e intuitivo (BI) y transformar la eficiencia operativa de las compa√±√≠as mediante la automatizaci√≥n de tareas y procesos en su √°rea de Robotic Cognitive Automation (RCA). Por ello, somos l√≠deres en proyectos de implantaci√≥n de soluciones tecnol√≥gicas como Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (anteriormente Microsoft Dynamics NAV o Navision), Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM, Power Platform, QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau y Robotics.

¬øC√≥mo te imaginamos?

En estos momentos buscamos profesionales Graduados/as en Ingenier√≠as, Matem√°ticas, F√≠sica o en ADE, Econom√≠a, Empresa y Tecnolog√≠a o carreras afines con inquietudes tecnol√≥gicas para incorporarse en nuestro equipo de BI en las oficinas de Barcelona. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Organization

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About The Team

Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

About The Role

The B2C Analytics team focuses on developing analytics solutions to help the organization make better data driven decisions. Our team is passionate about enabling others to use data and analysis to measure and monitor performance, identify risks and opportunities and find ways to continually add value.

You will primarily support the Consumer side of the business, which includes WSJ, Barron's, MarketWatch and more; but may also include exposure to other areas of the business, such as advertising and the professional information business. The ideal candidate will have previous experience in developing datasets, dashboards and data solutions that drive core insights. You will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

You Will

Develop Stakeholder Partnerships


Develop strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Newsroom, Finance, Data Collection, Data Engineering and other B2C Stakeholder Business teams and work across all levels and areas of the organization.
Executie data project roadmaps based on Business teams' priorities.


Understand B2C Data


Build a deep understanding of all the B2C data sources that we leverage in our Analysis projects
Partner with data engineers and data collection colleagues to collect, cleanse and organize data.


Conduct Analysis, Create Dashboards, Improve Processes & Ensure Quality


Analyze large datasets to surface trends and deliver recommendations with tangible business outcomes.
Create intuitive reports, dashboards and data solutions using visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker Studio)
Continuously identify ways to improve and streamline processes around data and reporting
Ensure the quality of data and reporting, and partner with teams to improve accuracy and consistency


Clearly Communicate


Communicate technical information clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences


You Have


Team oriented and collaborative with eagerness to help others, and aspiration to be challenged and learn
Self starter able to work independently, coordinate with multiple partners and complete projects start to finish
Detail oriented with focus on assuring quality, consistency and accuracy in data and processes
Undergraduate degree or equivalent in combination of training and experience, preferably in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related disciplines.
Experience working with large datasets in a fast-paced and fluid environment with the ability to understand and solve complex non-routine problems.
Experience with SQL and strong knowledge of Excel/Sheets required. Familiarity with Github, Python/R preferred.
Experience with web analytics tools (particularly Google Analytics 4 and Adobe Analytics) is a plus.
Experience with data visualizations tools and techniques, and using data to tell a story (e.g. Tableau, Looker)


Our Benefits


Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
Paid Time Off
Retirement Plans
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Lifestyle programs & Wellness Resources
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Commuter Transit Program
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program


\

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. We strongly encourage applications from all qualified individuals, including women, people with disabilities, and those from underrepresented groups. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Ecolab Company has an opening for an Data Analyst Trainee in our Procurement Analytics and Digital Solutions (ADS) team located in Barcelona, Spain. If you are a passionate professional that is seeking opportunity, advancement, and a rewarding learning chance and career we invite you to apply. This is a fantastic opportunity to join a highly recognized global growth company offering competitive compensation and benefits in addition to career growth.

Job Overview

As a part of the Data Operations team in the Global Supply Chain Analytics and Digital Solutions group you will be responsible for continuous improvements in digital capabilities and advanced analytics. You will lead the development of new digital products providing critical insights that help solve business challenges. The successful candidate will lead efforts to improve the chemical data understanding across the organization through improved process, governance, and data management.

Candidates must display a passion for systems, data, operational reporting & advanced analytics. The strong performer can expect further career advancement opportunities with Ecolab and will have the chance to move into other roles within Procurement or the organization, with increasing leadership opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to advance your career with a stable growing company!

Main Responsibilities


Serve as a liaison among stakeholders to analyze, document, and validate requirements for reporting and changes to business processes
Develop and maintain data products
Develop, test, and operationalize new standardized reporting
Develop and maintain business intelligence dashboards
Lead automation of processes and analyses
Train other teams in systems, tools, and processes owned by ADS
Proactively make recommendations and identify opportunities to solve business problems through new business intelligence reporting
Interface with IT to specify and implement improvements to our data pipelines


Basic Qualifications


Masters in Data Science or Statistics or Computer Science or equivalent advance degree.
Interest in an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and business intelligence (BI) role
Experience with AI and BI data modeling and presenting insights to key stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in Python, PySpark, SQL, Azure AI, Tenserflow, Streamlit, Flask, Power Apps, Power BI, Snowflake, Azure SQL Database.
Intermediate SQL skills, or willingness to learn.
Fluent English
Full-time availability.
To be eligible for the Traineeship contract you must have completed your bachelor's or master's degree studies.
Work permit in Barcelona.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience designing and building standard reports and dashboards
History of managing and delivering projects, tasks, and initiatives
Ability to create, implement, document, and continuously improve processes in a changing environment
Training or experience in data science areas such as time series analysis, forecasting, classification, and regression analysis
Experience with data analytics tools such as Python, R, SPSS, MATLAB, Stata, and SAS
Experience working with global cross-functional teams and demonstrated ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical expertise
Microsoft PowerBI experience
Project management experience
Experience in the petrochemical industry a plus
Enrolled in or recently completed degree with emphasis in Chemistry, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or Engineering preferred


Ecolab‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) reflects our longstanding value of working together to integrate diverse perspectives to challenge ourselves, reach our goals and do what‚Äôs right. Disability certificate will be an asset.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of Equal Opportunity to Employment. Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. We will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, Ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,‚ÄØcitizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic‚ÄØinformation, marital status, age, or disability.
