Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Tracking & Analytics
Description:
Are you eager to develop and implement tracking and analytics solutions that help large international companies make informed decisions?

Do you want to join our ambitious journey within data tracking & analytics?

Are you ready to make a real impact on how global brands use data?

At s360, we're not just collecting data ‚Äì we're turning it into actionable insights that drive business growth.

Join our new team in Barcelona and help shape the future of ad-tech in a dynamic, startup-like environment while being part of a leading North European agency.

Your key responsibilities You will play a crucial role in delivering and advising on tracking and analytics solutions for our clients.

Overall your responsibilities will encompass the development and implementation of durable measurement and tracking setups.

More Specifically, Your Responsibilities Will Include

Responsible for own portfolio of clients within tracking & analyticsDriving strategic roadmaps towards a durable measurement setupPlanning, project management, and execution as primary or part of projects for clients on an ad hoc basisAdvising and configuration of e.g.

Google Analytics 4, Consent Mode, Enhanced Conversions, Conversion API, and Consent Management Platform (Cookiebot and Cookie Information)Testing, auditing, and ensuring the quality of tracking setupsDeveloping documentation and implementing both smaller and larger tracking setupsImplementing and adjusting conversion tracking/pixel across various channels and platformsDebugging and resolving ad hoc tracking issues About your future team You will join our Measurement team who each day collaborate to make sure our clients succeed.

We strive to work closely on projects, complex cases, and troubleshooting while having fun and prioritising the social aspects of working together.

Staying ahead with the latest technologies and products is part of our DNA, ensuring our clients gain a competitive advantage through future-proof tracking setups.

Moreover, as part of our new Barcelona team, you'll contribute to building a collaborative environment.

You will help shape the growth of our office and contribute to building a culture that thrives on innovation, teamwork, and the shared goal of delivering exceptional results for our clients.

Your profile You have 4-6 years of hands-on experience from e.g.

a digital agency or an in-house role in a digital company.

You possess high professionalism as well as personal integrity and thrive in a fast-paced environment, where we constantly strive to improve and create more value for our clients.

Furthermore, You

High-level user of Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager for ecommerceHave a working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptHave experience in driving larger tracking & analytics projects for complex setups and client organisationsComfortable explaining complex and technical concepts both verbally and in writingAble to communicate in English with colleagues and external stakeholders from various locationsAre a problem-solver, unafraid of tackling challenging tasksAre detail-oriented and structured, taking pride in delivering thorough solutionsHave a direct and open communication style, and you are comfortable with giving and receiving constructive feedbackAppreciate collaborative sparring and knowledge-sharing within the team, coupled with the ability to work independently and manage tasks in a structured mannerNote: You must be eligible to work in Spain and the EU without requiring sponsorship.

What we offer You will be a part of a strong team with some of the industry's top specialists who all strive to ensure that our next delivery is always better than before.

You will join an international team working with clients across the s360 group.

Moreover, you will be a part of a company characterised by:

A culture that is down-to-earth and full of constructive feedback and sparring that drives your personal and professional developmentFreedom under responsibility and flexible working hoursAmbitious and professional colleagues - who also like to have fun!Continuous learning and development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.Social events like our MeetUp for all s360-employeesOur office in the popular Norrsken House Barcelona offers the city's best location with views of the beach and W-hotel, as well as many social and networking activities.

We'd love to hear from you! Is this the right fit for you?

Then don't hesitate to apply or reach out to Alex Sauer, VP & Group Head of Measurement at ******.

We review applications on an ongoing basis and hire as soon as the right candidate is found, so please send your CV and application as soon as possible.

All inquiries are treated confidentially.

About s360 s360 is a leading Northern European digital marketing agency that helps brands and retailers grow by providing a strong tech foundation, best-in-class execution, and deep industry expertise.

With a team of +300 digital specialists, s360 operates ten offices across seven countries: Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and Spain.

In recent years, s360 has been recognised with numerous national and European awards, making it one of Europe's most award-winning digital marketing agencies.

Title: Intern Global E-Commerce Data Analyst - English Speaker
Description:
About this Position Are you a curious, data driven and energetic individual willing to solve critical challenges with passion and innovation? Are you seeking to be the connection between our internal international teams and agencies? If this sounds like you, keep reading! Successful candidate will be part of our E-commerce Global team that defines, develops, and executes the eCommerce strategy for Henkel Consumer Adhesives.

What You¬¥ll Do


Support Ecom global team in the roll-out of data usage and strategies across countries.
Deliver high quality reports and analysis for our stakeholders (global teams)
Tracks, processes, analyses and verifies data in order to improve accuracy and quality.
Regular trend research and competitive analyses.
Own set of responsibilities for one or several projects.


What makes you a good fit


Degree in controlling, statistics, information science, mathematics or similar.
Excellent knowledge of English
Very good command of MS Office, specifically Excel & analytical skills is required
Hands-on experience with common visualization tools is a plus, such as Power BI, Tableau or others
Goal oriented working-style, reliable in project management
Initiative team player who enjoys working in a challenging and exciting environment
Good interpersonal and communication skills


Some perks of joining Henkel


Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
Diverse national and international growth opportunities
Meal Allowance for each worked day
Discounts on company products


At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

Title: Data Analyst - Insights (Paid Marketing Optimization)
HTML:
We power people‚Äôs progress.

At Preply, we‚Äôre all about creating life-changing learning experiences. We help people discover the magic of the perfect tutor, craft a personalized learning journey, and stay motivated to keep growing. Our approach is human-led, tech-enabled - and it‚Äôs creating real impact. So far, 90,000 tutors have delivered over 20 million lessons to learners in more than 175 countries. Every Preply lesson sparks change, fuels ambition, and drives progress that matters.

Meet the team!

At Preply, we're growing a talented Data Team to empower top-notch decision-making across our organization. Our team collaborates closely with various other chapters - including product, business, and platform - leveraging analysis, experimentation, causal inference, and machine learning.

You‚Äôll be embedded in cross-functional teams, partnering with our MarTech Product Manager, Marketeers, Tech Leads, and the Data Strategy team. Check out our Tech Radar to see the tools and technologies we love using at Preply!

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Own and design Preply‚Äôs marketing performance dashboard in Looker, ensuring it serves as the single source of truth for decision-making;
  • Be the go-to person for our channel managers, conducting deep dives into channel performance, campaign performance and creative performance;
  • Perform elasticity analysis to identify saturated or high potential markets and channels and to maximize our efficiency;
  • Setup automated processes with our Data Strategy team to identify outliers and in-efficiencies in our marketing spend;
  • Leverage SQL and LookML to build custom data models and explorers for self-serve analytics;
  • Work closely with our MarTech team and overlook the go-live of new marketing networks as well as tracking improvements, such as deep-links and cross-device tracking;
  • Weave together marketing measurement outputs from incrementality tests, attribution and MMM provided by the Data Science team and help stakeholders interpret results even if those insights are ambiguous;
  • Set up and lead weekly steering meetings with stakeholders to align on findings, identify gaps, and make data-informed budget and strategy decisions.

What You Need To Succeed

  • Experience analyzing and handling data from web and app tracking tools such as GA4 or MMPs for marketing attribution and user journey analysis;
  • Proven track record working with network data such as Google Ads, TikTok or Meta and conducting deep-dives for marketing managers;
  • Comfort working with ambiguous data, and ability to guide stakeholders through uncertainty with clear recommendations;
  • Strong proficiency in SQL;
  • Experience with Looker, including hands-on use of LookML to build and maintain dashboards and data models;
  • Experience in environments with cross-device user behavior (web and app), and understanding of tracking complexities across platforms;
  • Excellent communication and storytelling skills, able to distill complex analyses into simple, impactful narratives.

Nice To Have

  • Experience with SKAN (StoreKit Ad Network) and privacy-preserving attribution methods on iOS;
  • Familiarity with experimentation platforms, uplift modeling, or Bayesian methods;
  • Experience in environments with cross-device user behavior (web and app), and understanding of tracking complexities across platforms.

Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply

  • An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;
  • A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;
  • A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;
  • Not in Barcelona? We offer an attractive relocation package to join us in our Preply Barcelona Hub;
  • Access to free mental health support platforms;
  • Access to Gympass-partnered wellness and gym centers throughout Spain to promote and support well-being and physical health;
  • The opportunity to unlock the potential of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).

Our Principles

  • Care to change the world - We are passionate about our work and care deeply about its impact to be life changing.
  • We do it for learners - For both Preply and tutors, learners are why we do what we do. Every day we focus on empowering tutors to deliver an exceptional learning experience.
  • Keep perfecting - To create an outstanding customer experience, we focus on simplicity, smoothness, and enjoyment, continually perfecting it as every detail matters.
  • Now is the time - In a fast-paced world, it matters how quickly we act. Now is the time to make great things happen.
  • Disciplined execution - What makes us disciplined is the excellence in our execution. We set clear goals, focus on what matters, and utilize our resources efficiently.
  • Dive deep - We leverage business acumen and curiosity to investigate disparities between numbers and stories, unlocking meaningful insights to guide our decisions.
  • Growth mindset - We proactively seek growth opportunities and believe today's best performance becomes tomorrow's starting point. We humbly embrace feedback and learn from setbacks.
  • Raise the bar - We raise our performance standards continuously, alongside each new hire and promotion. We build diverse and high-performing teams that can make a real difference.
  • Challenge, disagree and commit - We value open and candid communication, even when we don‚Äôt fully agree. We speak our minds, challenge when necessary, and fully commit to decisions once made.
  • One Preply - We prioritize collaboration, inclusion, and the success of our team over personal ambitions. Together, we support and celebrate each other's progress.

Diversity, Equity, And Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

Title: Data Analyst with Tableau
Description:
Looking for a company that challenges you every day?


At ERNI, you will have the opportunity to develop customized software solutions that have an actual impact on people life‚Äôs and on the society. Therefore, you will be dealing with concepts like sophistication, quality, complexity and/or regulations.

Our leadership in the Health-Tech (Diagnostic Medical Devices, Pharma, Health Care‚Ä¶) and in all industries around Smart Devices (Robots, Cars, 3D Printers, Machinery‚Ä¶), in a powerful combination with the way we growth people, let us create a growing, learning and challenging set up for ERNIans.

We build digital solutions that connect the physical world (devices & connectivity) with the digital one (software solutions embedded, connected, or consuming their data). You will be part of teams prioritizing the software lifecycle & ensuring that our code is both clean and secure. Our maturity in building high-impact software solutions approaches us whatever industry looking for quality and sophistication (e.g. Gaming, FMCG or Validation & Inspection..).

If this sounds interesting for you and you are ready to boost your skills in Data. Join our project in the Pharma sector to work on the development of¬†a¬†solution that enables managing and organizing data and processes to facilitate collaboration and compliant access to data.




How ERNI cares about YOU¬†

üìöPaid and rewarded certifications: you will be able to learn new technologies to develop as a professional in the areas that interest you most (such as: Agile, DevOps, Cloud, QA, etc.) and be rewarded from 200‚Ç¨ to 1.400‚Ç¨ per certification, in addition to the paid exam.¬†

üèÜHigh Value Training: after a year at ERNI, you will have the opportunity to enroll on +500‚Ç¨ Executive courses, Masters or Postgraduates. 80% of the total amount will be covered by the company.¬†

üëåHybrid working model: at ERNI we believe in the importance of building strong relationships with our colleagues, projects and customers. We believe that building these relationships is much more effective when done in person.¬†

üè†Home Office: you will receive an extra monthly compensation to cover your teleworking expenses, as well as any necessary equipment to be comfortable doing your job.¬†

üåçFar Home Office: you can extend your holidays and work remotely from any European country or Spanish city up to 5 weeks per year.¬†

üí´Flexible working shift*: you will enjoy a Friday intensive shift and a self-managed flexible working hours.¬†

ü§ùPermanent contract: there is always a project for you to keep working with us, you will always find a project that fits your expectations in our people allocation meetings.¬†

üöÄChallenging projects: ERNI is dedicated to develop high-quality software in complex technical environments such as pharmaceutics, biotechnology, robotics and 4.0 industry. With us, you will have the chance to participate in a variety of technical challenging projects amongst passionate and skilled colleagues.¬†

¬†üë®‚ÄçüéìTechnical trainings with our Experts: You will have the possibility to request unlimited one-to-one sessions with a technical subject expert, where you will have the opportunity to ask about new technologies, level up your expertise in any technical field, to learn specific topics or more advanced topics like how to change your technical career from one technology to another.

‚≠êProximity and support:¬†from the first day at ERNI, you will be guided by a Mentor and a People Development team that will make sure you have the right tools to develop and give you opportunities to grow in a project or to switch to a new one. You will also be able to count with the support of a Godparent who will guide and assist you with anything you need. You can ask them any questions or concerns you have about your daily activities.

üëÇCommunication: you will find transparency, honesty, and open communication all over the organization through a breakfast with our MD and a monthly session to be updated on what‚Äôs going on at ERNI.¬†

üèÖPromotions & Recognition: from the very first day, we offer you a way to learn and develop yourself in our company. All efforts are always recognized and appreciated by your colleagues and superiors which makes feel satisfied with your own achievements.


üéâ5 and 10 years at ERNI: we would want to celebrate two important milestones on your ERNI journey, your 5th and 10th anniversary with a celebration where all your colleagues will share some words of thanks. On the 5th anniversary, you will receive a special package at home, a restaurant voucher for two, and 3,000‚Ç¨ on your monthly payroll. For the 10th anniversary, you will receive 7,000‚Ç¨ on your monthly payroll, a special package at home and a gateway for two.¬†

üí≠Free languages courses: learn German and Spanish or improve your English skills with our external teachers in small groups once per week.¬†

ü©∫Private medical insurance: we will offer you a private medical insurance for you and a 100% salary coverage on sickness leave.¬†

üíäSickness leave: ERNI is with you during tough moments by offering 100% salary coverage during sickness leave. Moreover, if you feel sick one day, there is no need to go to the doctor and get sickness leave for that specific day because ERNI also covers you with the salary.

üçºMaternity and paternity leave: We support you and your family with 16 weeks of maternity and paternity leave.

üí∞Flexible compensation: you will be able to dedicate part of your gross salary to different options such as transportation bonus, ticket restaurant, kindergarten bonus and to also to be able to add a family member into your own insurance plan.¬†

ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èWorkout Benefit: We are committed to promote a healthy lifestyle and increase the well-being of each ERNIan, so you will have special discounts on fitness facilities and we will compensate 12‚Ç¨ per month who presents an invoice for any sport-related activity (dance classes, padel lessons, etc.).

‚úàÔ∏èRe-allocation funding: if you are coming from abroad, we will help to become a part of our company with a relocation package bonus from 1.000‚Ç¨ to 2.000‚Ç¨.¬†

ü§ëReferral program: you will receive an extra bonus with our ‚ÄúCandidate‚Äôs referral program‚Äù from 2.000‚Ç¨ to 6.000‚Ç¨ depending on the candidate seniority level; and an extra bonus, also with our ‚ÄúBusiness opportunity referral program‚Äù from 500‚Ç¨ to 5.000‚Ç¨ depending on the opportunity size and customer.¬†

üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èLife support: to strengthen our commitment to conciliation and willingness of being close in your day-to-day life and important moments. We provide you a set of services and benefits, free of charge for, to assist you and your family in legal consultation, personal assistance, etc.¬†

üíÉEvents: we do believe in the importance of meeting our colleagues in an informal and natural environment to build connections and foster trust so that we feel like home. Leisure events, Christmas dinner and summer party are waiting for you!

üèñÔ∏èHolidays: You will have 23 vacation days per year to enjoy resting, with your family or friends.

¬†

To be a best fit for this project you will need:

Over 3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.

Proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and analysis.

Experience with Tableau for data visualization and reporting.

Familiarity with AWS is a plus.

Knowledge of ETL processes and tools.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

High level of English, written & spoken.

¬†

You will be responsible for:

Utilizing SQL for various data analysis tasks. This includes writing queries to extract, manipulate, and analyze data effectively.
Managing databases efficiently to ensure data integrity and accessibility for analysis purposes.
Leveraging tools like Tableau to perform in-depth data analysis tasks, including data extraction, manipulation, and visualization to derive actionable insights.
Demonstrating a strong problem-solving mindset and the ability to troubleshoot and debug issues that may arise during the data analysis process.
Identifying and resolving errors in data, optimizing performance of data processes, and ensuring data accuracy throughout the analysis lifecycle.

We value diversity not only in terms of gender but also nationality, background, and skills. This diversity enriches our teams and allows us to create better solutions for our clients.¬†Every employee at ERNI has an equal opportunity to succeed.¬†Learn more about our initiatives¬†üîé:

Diversity and inclusion

Are you still curious? Discover what it is to become part of ERNI:

Careers at ERNI | Work with Us (betterask.erni)

Also, if yo want to know what¬†makes ERNI unique through the eyes of those who know it best üòé Take a look at this video:

ERNI in One Word - YouTube

Title: Product Analyst, Chat
Description:
Department: Customer Happiness, Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote/Barcelona

Reporting To: Stanislav Fedyakov

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn, and save, by reshaping their relationship with money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 32,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and Shein, use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby has generated over $7 billion in transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing app of any fintech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched operations in 2020 and has raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors.

We are looking for a Product Analyst to contribute to the evolution of Tabby. This Product Analyst will join our Customer Happiness team and focus on enhancing the customer support experience. This includes optimizing chat tools, AI-driven chatbots, and other self-service solutions.

You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Design, Customer Experience, and Product teams.

Key Responsibilities


Provide analytical support to the product and business teams across all facets of their work, including evaluation of new product features in terms of revenue and cost
Generate hypotheses, conduct research and A/B tests, and present your findings clearly and compellingly highlighting the importance of your insights.
Support and monitor existing metrics related to chat, identify areas for improvement, and develop new metrics that inform decision-making across the organization.
Develop data visualizations and reports that are informative and easily understood by business and product teams.
Assist in the planning of necessary data structures.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Product / Data Analyst.
Proficiency in SQL and relational databases.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, particularly Tableau.
Experience in planning data structures for new products and features.
Experience in designing and conducting A/B tests.
Knowledge of Python (Pandas, Numpy, Statsmodels, Matplotlib, etc.) is a plus.
Strong quantitative skills and a structured approach to problem-solving. Ability to analyze issues, identify root causes, and recommend solutions.
Passionate about ensuring the quality of the products your team would deliver.
Strong English speaking skills, both verbally and writing.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration; at the moment, those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, the UAE, and Remote.


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company‚Äôs employee stock options program.
Health Insurance



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Operations Graduate
Description:
Teladoc Health is a leading company in telemedicine and virtual healthcare, providing digital health services, including online medical consultations, mental health therapy, chronic disease management, and overall wellness solutions. At Teladoc Health, we are revolutionizing access to healthcare with innovative telemedicine solutions. As we continue to increase our global reach and expand our ability to provide virtual care across the world, we are currently recruiting an Operations Analyst working from the Barcelona office.

Are you a tech-savvy Engineering Graduate eager to dive into real-world projects and leave your mark on the healthcare industry? Join our Operations team at Teladoc Health and work on innovative initiatives that help transform how people access and experience healthcare.

What You‚Äôll Do

You‚Äôll gain hands-on experience working on a variety of projects across different domains, such as:


Data analysis: Support projects by analyzing and interpreting data to generate insights and enhance our systems
System optimization: Collaborate on enhancing existing tools, platforms, or processes to improve efficiency and scalability
Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with diverse teams to solve complex challenges and deliver impactful results
Project Planning and Execution: Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation, to ensure successful delivery
Digital Transformation Leadership: Lead large-scale digital transformation initiatives, coordinating dedicated program and project teams to drive impactful changes
Professional Growth & Exposure: Work alongside experienced and talented professionals from companies such as McKinsey, BCG, and others


What We‚Äôre Looking For

We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree (or are currently pursuing one) in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Are fluent in both Spanish and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Possess excellent organizational and analytical abilities, with a resourceful and problem-solving mindset.
Are an effective communicator, capable of leading multidisciplinary teams and articulating complex ideas clearly.
Have strong interpersonal skills and a passion for building and maintaining long-term stakeholder relationships


How To Apply

Ready to take the next step? Send your CV and a brief cover letter explaining your interest in this position to miriam.cuartero@teladochealth.com

We look forward to welcoming you to our team and helping you grow, innovate, and succeed at Teladoc Health!
Show more

  • Are fluent in both Spanish and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Possess excellent organizational and analytical abilities, with a resourceful and problem-solving mindset.
  • Are an effective communicator, capable of leading multidisciplinary teams and articulating complex ideas clearly.
  • Have strong interpersonal skills and a passion for building and maintaining long-term stakeholder relationships

How To Apply

Ready to take the next step? Send your CV and a brief cover letter explaining your interest in this position to miriam.cuartero@teladochealth.com

We look forward to welcoming you to our team and helping you grow, innovate, and succeed at Teladoc Health!

Title: Flight Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

WELCOME TO SITA

We're the team that keeps airports moving, airlines flying smoothly, and borders open. Our tech and communication innovations are the secret behind the success of the world‚Äôs air travel industry.

You'll find us at 95% of international hubs. We partner closely with over 2,500 transportation and government clients, each with their own unique needs and challenges. Our goal is to find fresh solutions and cutting-edge tech to make their operations run like clockwork. Want to be a part of something big?

Are you ready to love your job? The adventure begins right here, with you, at SITA.

About The Role & Team

Our OptiFlight solution is a key pillar in SITA‚Äôs contribution to a greener, more sustainable aviation through the enablement of flight and air traffic optimization.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Head of OptiOps team, the Customer Applications Support (QAR) team is overall responsible for the following key activities:


Facilitate QAR flow.
Support in the configuration of QAR data decoder for new integrations.
Monitor and manage the quality of decoding.
Continuously Review and improve the overall process flow.



You will learn from an experienced QAR engineers and also interact with the various functions within SITA FOR AIRCRAFT such as Engineering & Technology, Product, and other colleagues across the company, located in 20+ countries (Canada, United-States, France, Switzerland, Germany, Singapore, United Arab Emirates, Spain...).

What You‚Äôll Do

In this role, you will gain hands-on experience in flight data management and optimization through various responsibilities, including:


Assisting in configuring QAR decoders to integrate new aircraft and aircraft types into the SITA for Aircraft library.
Supporting the configuration and maintenance of data flows to ensure seamless data acquisition and processing.
Contributing to the monitoring and validation of data quality by analyzing logs and error files to detect and resolve issues.
Collaborating with the team to troubleshoot data-related problems, optimize decoding processes, and enhance overall system performance.
Participating in continuous improvement initiatives to streamline workflows and enhance the effectiveness of QAR data integration and processing.



This role provides a unique opportunity to work closely with experts and teams across different functions, deepening your understanding of flight data analysis

Qualifications

ABOUT YOUR SKILLS


Degree in Aeronautical Engineering with good knowledge of flight data analysis.
Good understanding of the aeronautical domain.
Minimum 1-2 years of relevant experience in fight data analysis, FOQA or safety related role (SMS).
Knowledge regarding aircraft flight data acquisition system and sensors.
Understanding of aircraft parameters.
Practical experience working with Python and Linux environments.
Git common knowledge.
Proactive with good communication skills.



NICE-TO-HAVE


Bash programming
Flight data decoding skills (ARINC717 & ARINC767)
Knowledge of Rancher (Kubernetes management tool)



What We Offer

We‚Äôre all about diversity. We operate in 200 countries and speak 60 different languages and cultures. We‚Äôre really proud of our inclusive environment. Our offices are comfortable and fun places to work, and we make sure you get to work from home too. Find out what it's like to join our team and take a step closer to your best life ever.

üè° Flex Week: Work from home up to 2 days/week (depending on your team‚Äôs needs)

‚è∞ Flex Day: Make your workday suit your life and plans.

üåé Flex Location: Take up to 30 days a year to work from any location in the world.

üåøEmployee Wellbeing: We‚Äôve got you covered with our Employee Assistance Program (EAP), for you and your dependents 24/7, 365 days/year. We also offer Champion Health - a personalized platform that supports a range of wellbeing needs.

üöÄProfessional Development: Level up your skills with our training platforms, including LinkedIn Learning!

üôåüèΩ Competitive Benefits: Competitive benefits that make sense with both your local market and employment status.

SITA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value a diverse workforce. In support of our Employment Equity Program, we encourage women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities to apply and self-identify in the application process.

Title: BI Data Analyst - Hybrid
Description:
BI Data Analyst - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking an experienced BI Data Analyst to join our team in Barcelona. Our Business Intelligence team is the centre of excellence for providing insights and learning from the Data. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

Millions of customers every year across 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 7M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 6 billion daily AI predictions[e1]

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents ‚Äì 99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. As a Data Analyst in the BI team, you will be in charge of:


Analyse performance and identify behaviours in different data sets; Translate complex and potentially ambiguous information into a clear structure and actionable deliverables.
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality;
Build and maintain dashboards and/or reports to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;
Identify and analyze relevant customer data to drive business goals and validate hypothesis & designs; turn data into actionable insights;
Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge
Working with multi-disciplinary teams ‚Äì Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers ‚Äì to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets.



What you need to succeed:

Job Requirements

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or other quantitative fields);
Minimum 3 years of experience as an analyst in a digital and eCommerce environment.
Strong knowledge of tools and programming languages such as BigQuery/SQL, Python, R;
Experience with cloud platforms and scalable solutions will be a plus.
Self-starter with good time management skills; able to manage multiple tasks and prioritize quickly the most relevant ones;
Ability to multitask; desire to work in a challenging, fast-paced, high-performance environment;
Written and oral communication skills (in English).



Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Applied AI Tools: Demonstrated comfort using practical AI tools such as GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, or other AI-powered coding assistants.
Experimentation Mindset: Curiosity and eagerness to explore, experiment with, and integrate emerging AI-driven solutions into software development workflows.
AI-Enhanced Problem Solving: Ability to effectively leverage AI tools to debug code, streamline development processes, and enhance productivity.
Adaptability and Learning Agility: Enthusiastic about continuously learning and quickly adapting to new AI features and capabilities.
Collaboration with AI: Experience or interest in collaborating closely with AI tools as ‚Äúpair programmers‚Äù to complement traditional software development practices.



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO! If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:

  • A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Competitive Intelligence
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Senior Analyst in our AXSI team, you'll lead competitive intelligence initiatives and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spearhead the development and execution of sophisticated analytical frameworks that shape & strengthen our market position.


Lead Competitive Analysis: Dive deep into market trends, analysing strategies employed by industry players to acquire budgets and launch campaigns with our clients.
Client Consultations: Conduct in-depth discussions with clients to understand their testing processes and decision-making factors when evaluating different advertising solutions.
Performance Testing: Design and implement sophisticated testing strategies to showcase Criteo's superior performance and value proposition.
Strategy Development: Contribute to our pool of competitive strategies and help shape the roadmap for our competitive intelligence tools.
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success.



Who You Are:


4+ years of experience in data analytics, with expertise in competitive intelligence and market analysis
Demonstrated experience leading and delivering strategic projects that directly impact business outcomes
Advanced proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools, with a track record of building scalable analytical solutions
Strong leadership skills with experience mentoring junior analysts and managing complex stakeholder relationships
Strategic mindset with proven ability to translate complex market insights into actionable business strategies
Experience presenting to and influencing senior stakeholders
Track record of developing and implementing innovative analytical methodologies
Advanced problem-solving skills with experience tackling ambiguous business challenges
Fluent in English with exceptional communication skills and ability to influence at all levels
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions



Diverse experiences enrich our team. Even if you don't tick every box, we want to hear from you!

We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Who You Are:

  • 4+ years of experience in data analytics, with expertise in competitive intelligence and market analysis
  • Demonstrated experience leading and delivering strategic projects that directly impact business outcomes
  • Advanced proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools, with a track record of building scalable analytical solutions
  • Strong leadership skills with experience mentoring junior analysts and managing complex stakeholder relationships
  • Strategic mindset with proven ability to translate complex market insights into actionable business strategies
  • Experience presenting to and influencing senior stakeholders
  • Track record of developing and implementing innovative analytical methodologies
  • Advanced problem-solving skills with experience tackling ambiguous business challenges
  • Fluent in English with exceptional communication skills and ability to influence at all levels
  • Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions


Diverse experiences enrich our team. Even if you don't tick every box, we want to hear from you!

We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Checkout Data Analyst
Description:
As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking a Tech Data Analyst to join our Checkout team in Barcelona (hybrid). If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 7M members in Prime

More than 100 million searches per day - Up to 6 billion daily AI predictions[e1]

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents ‚Äì 99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionising the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What You Will Do

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks


Build the infrastructure required for the extraction, transformation and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources.
Assemble large and complex datasets, with an optimal data pipeline architecture, meeting business requirements.
Implement processes to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes that depend on it.
Create alerts and dashboards to contribute to the monitoring and tracking of our business KPIs.
Identify, design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimising queries, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Collaborate with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed existing reports or create brand new reports with the aim to increase data accessibility and foster data-driven decision making across the organisation.
Contribute to the delivery of strategic projects by participating in the delivery of key initiatives, giving support to the analytics and business teams when it comes to data availability and visualisation to ensure progress and effective delivery of the desired outcomes. Work together with stakeholders in the execution of the projects.



What you need to succeed:

Good to have


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.).
Experience building and optimising data pipelines, data sets and workflow management tools (e.g. Airflow).
Advance knowledge of SQL is a requirement as well as experience working with databases and large sets of data; Python programming skills are also required as well as experience in data visualisation or exploration tools such as Looker Studio.
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with Microsoft and Google Office package (Excel, etc.).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with high attention to detail.
Strong organisational and communication skills.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!
Business Proficiency in English.



Preferred Qualifications


Experience with Applied AI Tools: Demonstrated comfort using practical AI tools such as GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, or other AI-powered coding assistants.
Experimentation Mindset: Curiosity and eagerness to explore, experiment with, and integrate emerging AI-driven solutions into software development workflows.
AI-Enhanced Problem Solving: Ability to effectively leverage AI tools to debug code, streamline development processes, and enhance productivity.
Adaptability and Learning Agility: Enthusiastic about continuously learning and quickly adapting to new AI features and capabilities.
Collaboration with AI: Experience or interest in collaborating closely with AI tools as ‚Äúpair programmers‚Äù to complement traditional software development practices.



What‚Äôs In It For You

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture. Here's what we offer:


A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, Competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.
Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.
Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.
Your Well-being is our Priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.
Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.
Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile Mindset environment with recognition at our core.



Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel. Apply now!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Who We Are

Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!

Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data Science & Analytics team in delivering high-quality insights through data exploration, analysis, and reporting. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, comfortable working with large datasets, automating processes, and supporting internal stakeholders with data-driven recommendations.

Responsibilities


Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, ensuring quality and reliability of results.
Respond to ad hoc client-specific requests including performing analyses, data manipulation and producing summary results.
Generate reports and visualizations to effectively communicate findings to stakeholders to support decision making
Support campaign performance analysis and contribute to benchmark development and optimization.
Design scripts and tools to automate and streamline data extraction processes using Python, SQL, and APIs.
Develop interactive dashboards and reporting tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, Streamlit) to provide a clear overview of key metrics and insights.
Collaborate with stakeholders to enhance data collection processes.


Qualifications

Required:


Master‚Äôs degree or Bachelors in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics or a related discipline).
1-2 year(s) of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.
Proficiency in Python (especially pandas and NumPy) for data manipulation.
Strong experience with MS Excel for analysis and reporting.
Experience working with large datasets and performing complex data transformations.
Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with internal teams and customers.
Self-starter with ability to work independently.


Additional Information

Nice to Have:


Experience in media measurement analytics.
Ability to write and optimize SQL queries.
Familiarity with Streamlit, Power BI, or Tableau for dashboarding.
Understanding of Databricks or similar cloud-based analytics platforms.


Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.


Innovation is in our blood


We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄAt Capgemini Invent, we drive change through inventive transformation consulting, blending strategic, creative, and scientific capabilities to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Join us to tailor transformations to our clients' challenges, validated by science and data, powered by creativity and design, and underpinned by purposeful technology.




Your Role

As a Junior Data Analyst professional, you will guide organizations in managing and leveraging their data assets to drive strategic business outcomes. Your focus will be on data quality, security, governance, and metadata management among others fields of practices.




üåêKey responsibilities:

Advising clients on data governance frameworks, data ethics policies, metadata management strategies, and master data management (MDM) solutions.
Integrating cutting-edge technologies into data management processes, leveraging machine learning and advanced analytics.
Shaping and executing engagements in Data Management, including Data Governance, Data Ethics, Data modeling, Data Architecture, Data Quality, and standards implementation.
Conducting assessments of clients' data maturity using frameworks like DCAM and DAMA.
Cultivating trusted client relationships to address key challenges in data management, analytics, and AI delivery.
Providing strategic counsel on maximizing the value of data-driven insights for business decision-making.
Supporting large-scale data transformations from conceptualization to implementation.
Collaborating with stakeholders to facilitate innovation initiatives.
Establishing robust data capabilities within client organizations, including process optimization and skills development.
Contributing to the development of our practice by identifying new market opportunities and creating thought leadership content.




üí°Your Profile:

Innovation: Ability to drive innovation in data management using cutting-edge technologies as Informatica or Collibra.
Value-Creation: Creating tangible value through effective data management and utilization of data assets.
Leadership: Potential as a leader in data management with relevant experience and success.
Strategic Thinking: Providing strategic guidance on data management and roadmap creation.
Stakeholder Management: Strong engagement skills with diverse stakeholders, discovering business needs.
Communication Skills: Effective communication to represent the company in data strategy discussions.
Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying abreast of advancements in data strategy and management.
Delivery: Track record of delivering within agile working environments.




üåüWhat You'll Love About Working Here

Join our rapidly growing Data & AI Strategy team at Capgemini Invent, where we design and build strategies to transform how organizations leverage data. Our commitment to innovation and AI-driven solutions creates unparalleled value for clients.




We offer flexibility, a positive work-life balance, through hybrid working (80%) and wellbeing options for our employees.




üìçLocation: Barcelona




Are you ready to take your career to the next level and drive the future of innovation with data?

Nuestra pr√°ctica tecnol√≥gica, se enfoca en ayudar a nuestros clientes en la optimizaci√≥n de sus procesos de negocio e incrementar la eficiencia de su organizaci√≥n (ERP), impulsar una relaci√≥n efectiva con sus clientes (CRM) y visualizar datos de su organizaci√≥n desde un prisma m√°s √°gil e intuitivo (BI) y transformar la eficiencia operativa de las compa√±√≠as mediante la automatizaci√≥n de tareas y procesos en su √°rea de Robotic Cognitive Automation (RCA). Por ello, somos l√≠deres en proyectos de implantaci√≥n de soluciones tecnol√≥gicas como Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central (anteriormente Microsoft Dynamics NAV o Navision), Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM, Power Platform, QlikView, Qlik Sense, Power BI, Tableau y Robotics.

¬øC√≥mo te imaginamos?

En estos momentos buscamos profesionales Graduados/as en Ingenier√≠as, Matem√°ticas, F√≠sica o en ADE, Econom√≠a, Empresa y Tecnolog√≠a o carreras afines con inquietudes tecnol√≥gicas para incorporarse en nuestro equipo de BI en las oficinas de Barcelona. No es necesaria experiencia previa, uni√©ndote a nuestro equipo te acompa√±aremos en tu proceso de aprendizaje, con profesionales que te ayudar√°n en tu evoluci√≥n y proyecci√≥n profesional.

¬øC√≥mo es trabajar en Deloitte?

ü§© Proyectos de alto impacto donde tendr√°s un largo recorrido y aprendizaje

‚òØÔ∏è Un d√≠a a d√≠a h√≠brido-flexible: tendr√°s horario flexible y un buen equilibrio entre el teletrabajo y el trabajo en equipo en nuestras oficinas o las de nuestros clientes

‚öΩ Buen ambiente dentro y fuera de la oficina: disfrutar√°s de varios teambuildings al a√±o, actividades culturales y deportivas‚Ä¶ ¬°y mucho m√°s!

üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Bienestar integral: cu√≠date con nuestro programa de salud f√≠sica, mental y financiera‚Ä¶ ¬°y con equipo m√©dico en las oficinas!

ü§≤ Impacto social: Podr√°s apuntarte a una gran cantidad de voluntariados de alcance nacional e internacional y a proyectos pro-bono con los que poner tu tiempo y talento al servicio de quienes m√°s lo necesitan

üó£Ô∏è Cultura del feedback y aprendizaje continuo: crecer√°s en un entorno inclusivo donde la igualdad de oportunidades y tu plan personalizado de formaci√≥n impulsar√°n tu desarrollo. ¬øYa te visualizas en la Deloitte University de Par√≠s?

ü§ù Beneficios exclusivos por ser parte de Deloitte: podr√°s disfrutar de un gran cat√°logo de beneficios y de un completo plan de retribuci√≥n flexible

Si te gusta lo que lees, estos son tus pr√≥ximos pasos:

  • Aplica a la oferta haciendo clic en ‚ÄòEnviar candidatura ahora‚Äô y completa tu perfil
  • Si encajas en el puesto, nuestro equipo de talento te contactar√° para conocerte mejor

¬°Comienza el proceso! Te iremos guiando por las diferentes fases hasta tu incorporaci√≥n.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
¬øTienes ganas de dar forma al futuro de los seguros?

En Prima, podr√≠as asumir un reto totalmente nuevo. Como parte de nuestra comunidad global, estar√°s en el asiento del conductor de tu carrera, aprendiendo y creciendo con un equipo de primer nivel a tu alrededor. Prima es un lugar en el que, independientemente de qui√©n seas o cu√°l sea tu funci√≥n, se valora tu voz.

En 2015, nos embarcamos en una misi√≥n: ofrecer un seguro de coche de gran valor dise√±ado para todos. Y hemos recorrido un largo camino, hemos creado una cultura en la que podemos impulsar el √©xito de los dem√°s. Pero necesitamos tu experiencia, ya que dirigimos las cosas en una direcci√≥n nueva y emocionante.

Probablemente est√©s pensando... "Esto suena muy bien". Estamos de acuerdo.

Adem√°s de grandes compa√±eros y proyectos interesantes, hay muchas maneras de ayudarte a hacer el mejor trabajo de tu vida. Hemos configurado nuestra oferta para centrarnos en el bienestar, la autonom√≠a y el desarrollo. Consideramos que los beneficios son el combustible que te permitir√° alcanzar el √©xito si decides embarcarte en este viaje con nosotros.

ü§∏üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Trabajar de la mejor manera para ti

Creemos en la conciliaci√≥n y la flexibilidad. Tanto si te gusta trabajar desde la oficina, desde casa o una mezcla de ambas. Te ayudaremos a encontrar el equilibrio que mejor se adapte a ti. Incluso tenemos una pol√≠tica que te permite trabajar desde cualquier lugar durante 30 d√≠as al a√±o. Confiamos en ti para que nos ayudes a avanzar.

üèÅ La libertad de explorar las posibilidades

En Prima nos movemos r√°pido, pero nos movemos juntos. Invertimos en tu crecimiento; por eso te daremos acceso a un mercado de ense√±anza y aprendizaje. Y tendr√°s sesiones regulares con tu manager para establecer un plan de crecimiento personal.

üåà Nuestra f√≥rmula ganadora: felices y de alto rendimiento

Desde seguros m√©dicos privados hasta descuentos en gimnasios e iniciativas de bienestar: estamos aqu√≠ para ayudarte. Sabemos lo importantes que son tu salud y tu bienestar, as√≠ que haremos todo lo posible para ayudarte.

Si te parece que tenemos algo para ti, veamos si tienes las aptitudes que buscamos

Te incorporar√°s como Data Analyst en el equipo de Online Sales & Marketing para apoyar a identificar y mejorar iniciativas de crecimiento y de eficiencia del negocio, analizando los principales factores que est√°n afectando y/o condicionando nuestro desempe√±o y resultados en ventas y en retenci√≥n de p√≥lizas.

En concreto, trabajar√°s con los diferentes equipos de Prima, con las siguientes responsabilidades:

Conversi√≥n online


Analizar los factores que impactan la conversi√≥n del funnel de los usuarios que llegan a nuestra p√°gina web por los diferentes canales, apoy√°ndote en el an√°lisis detallado de datos y en herramientas de an√°lisis web e interactuando con equipos de Product y de UX para identificar mejoras.
Crear y mantener dashboards en Tableau para respaldar las decisiones estrat√©gicas del equipo de Online Sales y dar soporte a los equipos de Product y Product Analytics.
Implementar un sistema de intercambio de datos con otros equipos locales y globales de la compa√±√≠a.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a aumentar la conversi√≥n online y mejorar la experiencia de usuario.
Trabajar con nuestros partners externos como Comparadores para mejorar nuestro posicionamiento y darles soporte en desarrollos que mejoren la experiencia de los usuarios y su potencial de conversi√≥n.


Eficiencia operativa


Analizar oportunidades para mejorar la eficiencia del equipo de Atenci√≥n al Cliente, dando soporte al Team Leader, a partir de los datos de las interacciones con clientes.
Fomentar iniciativas destinadas a mejorar los resultados y la contribuci√≥n de los agentes.
Crear dashboards de monitoreo y an√°lisis de desempe√±o con respecto a la fuente, el tipo de interacciones y actividades del cliente para mejorar la eficiencia.


Otras √°reas


Trabajar con otros Data Scientists y Data Analysts de la compa√±√≠a para desarrollar y fortalecer la cultura de datos de Prima, buscando y compartiendo mejores pr√°cticas.
Dar soporte a la Head of Online Sales & Marketing en iniciativas y proyectos estrat√©gicos, como el lanzamiento de nuevos canales online, o la definici√≥n de modelos de atribuci√≥n.


¬øQu√© buscamos?

Ser√≠as ideal para el equipo si cumples estos requisitos:


Al menos 3 a√±os de experiencia en an√°lisis de datos.
Buena experiencia en la creaci√≥n de datasets utilizando diferentes herramientas para manipulaci√≥n y extracci√≥n de datos (MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL).
Buenas habilidades de visi√≥n de negocio.
Habilidades anal√≠ticas y experiencia en la creaci√≥n de modelos en Excel o Tableau.
Grado universitario en campos afines al an√°lisis de datos (Estad√≠stica, Matem√°ticas, Ingenier√≠a, Inform√°tica, ADE o Econom√≠a).
Nivel de ingl√©s medio-avanzado, imprescindible para comunicarse entre los equipos globales.


Ser√≠a fant√°stico si...

Adem√°s de los requisitos b√°sicos, evaluaremos con atenci√≥n las siguientes caracter√≠sticas:


Experiencia usando herramientas de web analytics como Google Analytics y Content Square.
Buenas habilidades interpersonales y de negociaci√≥n, resoluci√≥n de problemas, determinaci√≥n.
Flexibilidad y actitud adaptativa.
Iniciativa y proactividad.
Experiencia con otras diferentes herramientas tecnol√≥gicas.


Prima es una comunidad formada por personas con talento y ambici√≥n. Ofrecemos igualdad de oportunidades de empleo y estamos orientados hacia la diversidad y la inclusi√≥n en el lugar de trabajo. Prohibimos todo tipo de discriminaci√≥n por motivos de raza, color, sexo, religi√≥n, orientaci√≥n sexual, nacionalidad, discapacidad, informaci√≥n gen√©tica, embarazo u otras caracter√≠sticas personales protegidas, tal y como se definen en la legislaci√≥n nacional.

Si te parece que encajamos bien, √∫nete a nosotros en el fast lane.
