Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Do you love transforming data into actionable insights?

At MIGSO-PCUBED, we are looking for a data-driven professional to develop dashboards, KPIs for a client in automotive sector. If you have strong Power BI skills, a keen analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate across teams, we want to hear from you! üöÄ Are you our next Data Analyst?


Your key responsibilities:

  • Develop dashboards;
  • Monitor and optimize data processing;
  • Identify opportunities to improve indicators, reports, and processes;
  • Conduct data analysis.


What you bring:

  • Advanced knowledge of Power BI;
  • At least 3 years of experience in dashboard, KPI creation and monitoring;
  • Familiarity with Phyton and SQL;
  • Previous experience in banking sector;
  • Background in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field is preferred;
  • Experience with statistical models;
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills with internal stakeholders;
  • Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
  • Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.


This is an hybrid position based in Porto.


Ready to take on this challenge? Apply now and join our team! üî•


You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Data Analyst | Retail
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Create and enhance projects in Java, Pyhton, Angular, PHP, .NET and so much more while diving in the world of Blockchain, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Security and Internet of Things.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

A Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Business.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Retail experience;
At least 8 years of experience in data analysis, with a demonstrated track record of delivering actionable insights and driving business impact;
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits


Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams, and Clients;
Teamwork skills but also a sense of autonomy;
Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included;
Willingness to collaborate with other players;
Strong communication skills.



At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

  • Strong communication skills.


At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Ensure the regular production of KPIs.

Ensure the quality of the produced KPIs.

Guarantee that KPIs are adequately commented on by the right stakeholders.

Reporting

Reports directly to the transversal IT structure.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Main Functions

Coordinate data collection, analysis, and transformation (ETL) and produce the necessary data for reports.

Create and produce periodic or on-demand reports on processes and data.

Ensure data quality and continuous improvement.

Manage evolution topics.

Work closely with the corporate IT organization with global contact.

Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

Main Skills

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or another relevant area.

Proficiency in English (French is a plus).

At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.

Strong expertise in Excel, Python, and ETL tools.

Expertise in Power BI is mandatory.

Ability to work autonomously.

Commitment to job and team objectives.

Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.

Strong commitment, demand for quality, and pedagogical skills.

Continuous focus on delivering high-quality results.

Adherence to procedures, methodologies, and directives.

Capacity to manage stress and conflicts effectively.

Good listening and questioning skills.

Ability to plan ahead and prioritize tasks.

Strong team spirit.

Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you‚Äôll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That‚Äôs why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company‚Äôs strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You‚Äôll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: Sustainability Analyst (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you passionate about sustainability, forward-thinking reporting, and shaping the future of corporate responsibility in a dynamic, international company? Then, this is the perfect opportunity for you! Join us as a Sustainability Analyst and contribute to Infineon‚Äôs global initiatives that make a difference.

Job Description

As a Sustainability Analyst, you will support key sustainability reporting and compliance efforts in a dynamic and international environment. You will help drive transparency, align with regulatory standards, and contribute to impactful initiatives across the organization.

In your new role, you will:


Assist in conducting the Double Material Assessment
Actively contribute to the preparation of non-financial reporting and collaborate on the development and implementation of concepts to meet future reporting requirements
Provide support for the overall reporting process and documentation
Conduct benchmarking activities and perform analyses
Coordinate effectively with internal interface partners
Coordinate legislative matters within the relevant field of activity
Participate in projects with a primary focus on non-financial reporting and related topics
Contribute to the EU Taxonomy assessment and classification by analyzing legal requirements and regulatory changes
Support global projects across the entire field of activity


Your Profile

You bring a sharp analytical mindset along with strong communication skills. You are solution-oriented, thrive in fast-paced environments, and enjoy working across cultures and departments to drive impactful results.

You are best equipped for this task if you have:


A degree in Sustainability, Natural Sciences or Economics, Business Law, or a similar field of studies
At least 2 years of professional experience in the field of sustainability or non-financial reporting in a company or auditing firm, preferably in an international and multicultural environment
Strong MS Office knowledge, especially Word, PowerPoint, and Excel
Good analytical skills, strong communication, teamwork mindset, and highly solution-oriented approach
Fluency in English ‚Äì proficiency in German would be an advantage


Please send us your CV in English.

Contact:

Carla Almeida, LinkedIn

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome at Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! -


Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.

At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Senior Risk Data Analyst - Fincrime & Fraud Monitoring
Description:
Hello! We're Teya.

Teya is a payment and software service provider, headquartered in London serving small, local businesses across Europe. Founded in 2019, we build easy to use, integrated tools that enable our members to accept payments and boost business performance.



At Teya we believe small, local businesses are the lifeblood of our communities.

We‚Äôre here because we don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs a level playing field that gives small businesses with a fighting chance against the giants of the high street.

We‚Äôre here because we see banks and legacy service providers making things harder for them. We don‚Äôt think the best technology or the best service should be reserved for those with the biggest headquarters.

We‚Äôre here to fight for a future where small, local businesses can thrive, and to commit the same dedication they offer all of us.



Become a part of our story.

We‚Äôre looking for exceptional talent to join our mission. We offer a chance to create impact in a high-energy and connected culture, while benefiting from continuous learning opportunities, a supportive community which is proud to serve our mission, and comprehensive benefits.





Job Description



The Team



The Customer Risk Monitoring team is responsible for implementing and maintaining the analytical intelligence that protects Teya and its customers from financial risks, including fraud, money laundering, and terrorism financing. Our goal is to minimise financial losses and risk exposure while supporting and maintaining our customers' trust and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements.



We work closely with the Operations team to investigate suspicious activities and collaborate cross-functionally with Compliance, Risk, Platform Engineering and product leaders to build and continuously improve the intelligence powering our detection and monitoring systems.







The role

As a Data Analyst in the Customer Risk Monitoring team, you will:



Develop and refine the intelligence used to detect financial crime, balancing efficacy with operational efficiency to reduce false positives, investigation time, and customer friction



Deliver actionable insights that directly improve detection rates, uncover new risk patterns, and inform prevention strategies



Act as a bridge between data and the business, collaborating closely with Operations, Compliance, Engineering, and Product teams to shape and prioritise analytical initiatives



Identify opportunities to improve and automate monitoring, escalate emerging threats, and continuously evolve our understanding of risk



Build and maintain clear and impactful dashboards, reports, and documentation to monitor key metrics, surface relevant trends, and drive data-informed decisions



Partner with data engineering to design and maintain scalable, reliable data models and ETLs that underpin both operational and strategic use cases



Help define and analyse fraud and AML KPIs, helping the business plan and course-correct with confidence



Promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organisation





Qualifications



We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst with a strong analytical foundation and a passion for tackling complex, ambiguous problems in the financial risk domain.



Must-haves



4+ years of professional experience as a data analyst, preferably in fraud, AML, or financial risk monitoring



Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying methods such as forecasting, time series analysis, A/B testing, or regression analysis



Experience in producing insights that led to measurable improvements, ideally in relevant domains such as fraud, AML detection, or operations



Advanced proficiency in SQL and experience working with large, complex, and sometimes messy datasets



Experience designing, building, and maintaining ETL pipelines or data models, ideally using tools like dbt



Proficiency in Python for data analysis, including data manipulation, visualisation, and basic modelling



Strong data storytelling and communication skills: you can translate complex data into clear, actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical stakeholders



Experience working collaboratively with cross-functional partners, including Operations, Compliance, Engineering and Product



Self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-ambiguity environment and takes ownership of their work from start to finish



Nice-to-haves



Experience in acquiring services or the payments industry



Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics)



Direct experience with problems such as AML scenario tuning, fraud rule optimisation, or detection intelligence design



Familiarity with regulatory or compliance-driven analytics environments



Fincrime certifications such as CAMS, ICA, or equivalent





Additional Information



The Perks



We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;



Health Insurance;



Meal Allowance;



25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);



Public Transportation Card;



Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;



Office snacks every day;



Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.



Show more

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics)

  • Direct experience with problems such as AML scenario tuning, fraud rule optimisation, or detection intelligence design

  • Familiarity with regulatory or compliance-driven analytics environments

  • Fincrime certifications such as CAMS, ICA, or equivalent



Additional Information

The Perks

  • We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;

  • Health Insurance;

  • Meal Allowance;

  • 25 days of Annual leave (+ Bank holidays);

  • Public Transportation Card;

  • Frequent team events & activities in the office and outside;

  • Office snacks every day;

  • Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.

HTML:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.


At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.


As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.


With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.


So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!


Benefits

  • Work up to 20 hours per week.
  • Earn a competitive rate of pay.
  • Develop your research skills.
  • Avoid the long commute.
  • Work from the comfort of your home office.
  • Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!


Ideal Candidate

  • Fluent in English and Portugese.
  • Excellent research skills.
  • Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
  • Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
  • Analytical mindset.


Job Requirements

  • Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
  • Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
  • Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
  • Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
  • Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
  • All work must be of an independent nature.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

Title: Research Building Analyst
Description:
About Bandora:¬†

At Bandora, we are shaping the future of building operations. Buildings are among the largest consumers of energy, accounting for nearly one-third of global CO2 emissions. Maintaining optimal indoor conditions in commercial buildings, especially those with multiple tenants, is a significant challenge. Bandora‚Äôs cloud-based platform leverages real-time IoT data to provide intelligent dashboards, analytics, anomaly detection, and automation to eliminate energy waste and enhance occupant comfort. Our mission is to create autonomous, greener, and more comfortable buildings.¬†




The Role:¬†

As a Research Building Analyst, you will be at the forefront of the company‚Äôs innovation. Your work will be crucial in the development of cutting-edge methods to control and automate building systems. You will collaborate closely with data/AI scientists to analyse complex datasets, develop models, and provide actionable insights. Your contributions will have a direct impact on how our cross-functional team makes decisions and innovates.¬†




Key Responsibilities:¬†

Analyse the energy consumption patterns of buildings and HVAC systems using historical data, simulations, and real-time production environments.¬†
Collaborate with data scientists to improve existing algorithms or develop innovative solutions for optimizing building energy performance and comfort.¬†
Create digital twins and simulation models, and investigate automated calibration methods.¬†
Actively contribute to team discussions and data-driven decision-making.¬†
Create clear and engaging data visualizations to effectively communicate findings.¬†
Document results, experiments, processes, methodologies, and interpretations in a structured and accessible manner.¬†




Required Skills:¬†

Msc in Mechanical Engineering or a related field.¬†
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with a proactive mindset.¬†
Good understanding of building equipment, especially HVAC systems and how they function.¬†
Expertise in building simulation tools, like EnergyPlus and OpenStudio.¬†
Experience with developing¬†digital twins.¬†
Ability to design, execute, and analyse experiments following robust scientific methodologies.¬†
Ability to create clear and insightful research documentation and reports.¬†
Proficiency in English, both written and verbal.¬†

¬†

Nice-to-Have:¬†

Knowledge in the behavior of building energy consumption, such as patterns and relationships with climate data.¬†
Understanding of BIM systems.¬†
Experience with advanced data analysis, statistical modeling or data mining.¬†
Skills with Python and Git.¬†
Experience with digital twin calibration.¬†

¬†

Why Join Us?¬†

This is an exciting opportunity to see your work making a real-world impact. You‚Äôll thrive in a collaborative and supportive environment, continuously grow your skills, and contribute to making the world a greener place.¬†

Show more
HTML:
About Bandora: 

At Bandora, we are shaping the future of building operations. Buildings are among the largest consumers of energy, accounting for nearly one-third of global CO2 emissions. Maintaining optimal indoor conditions in commercial buildings, especially those with multiple tenants, is a significant challenge. Bandora‚Äôs cloud-based platform leverages real-time IoT data to provide intelligent dashboards, analytics, anomaly detection, and automation to eliminate energy waste and enhance occupant comfort. Our mission is to create autonomous, greener, and more comfortable buildings. 


The Role: 

As a Research Building Analyst, you will be at the forefront of the company‚Äôs innovation. Your work will be crucial in the development of cutting-edge methods to control and automate building systems. You will collaborate closely with data/AI scientists to analyse complex datasets, develop models, and provide actionable insights. Your contributions will have a direct impact on how our cross-functional team makes decisions and innovates. 


Key Responsibilities: 

  • Analyse the energy consumption patterns of buildings and HVAC systems using historical data, simulations, and real-time production environments. 
  • Collaborate with data scientists to improve existing algorithms or develop innovative solutions for optimizing building energy performance and comfort. 
  • Create digital twins and simulation models, and investigate automated calibration methods. 
  • Actively contribute to team discussions and data-driven decision-making. 
  • Create clear and engaging data visualizations to effectively communicate findings. 
  • Document results, experiments, processes, methodologies, and interpretations in a structured and accessible manner. 


Required Skills: 

  • Msc in Mechanical Engineering or a related field. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with a proactive mindset. 
  • Good understanding of building equipment, especially HVAC systems and how they function. 
  • Expertise in building simulation tools, like EnergyPlus and OpenStudio. 
  • Experience with developing digital twins. 
  • Ability to design, execute, and analyse experiments following robust scientific methodologies. 
  • Ability to create clear and insightful research documentation and reports. 
  • Proficiency in English, both written and verbal. 

 

Nice-to-Have: 

  • Knowledge in the behavior of building energy consumption, such as patterns and relationships with climate data. 
  • Understanding of BIM systems. 
  • Experience with advanced data analysis, statistical modeling or data mining. 
  • Skills with Python and Git. 
  • Experience with digital twin calibration. 

 

Why Join Us? 

This is an exciting opportunity to see your work making a real-world impact. You‚Äôll thrive in a collaborative and supportive environment, continuously grow your skills, and contribute to making the world a greener place.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are


Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit; Counterparty; Equity; Market; Operational.
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Very good communication skills
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Proactivity
Risk management - Risk analysis
Technical skills ‚Äì R, VBA and Python

Title: Data analyst Tax Digitalisation
Description:
Company Description

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2023, Continental generated sales of ‚Ç¨41.4 billion and currently employs around 200,000 people in 56 countries and markets.

The Automotive group sector comprises technologies for passive safety, brake, chassis, motion, and motion control systems. Innovative solutions for assisted and automated driving, display and operating technologies, as well as audio and camera solutions for the vehicle interior, are also part of the portfolio, as is intelligent information and communication technology for the mobility services of fleet operators and commercial vehicle manufacturers. Comprehensive activities relating to connectivity technologies, vehicle electronics and high-performance computers round off the range of products and services.

Job Description


Actively shaping global digitalization in the tax environment for Automotive
Independently establishing new digitalization solutions.
Leading and participating in digitalization projects at the interface between business and IT.
International working environment.
Identifying digitalization potential to create synergies and increase efficiency.
Conducting software-based data analyses of complex business data (SAP data, customs data, external data, etc.).
Developing digital solutions using low-code and no-code platforms (PowerApps & Mendix).
Creating concepts, initiating, and leading national and international digitalization projects.
Monitoring and managing the allocated project budget.
Supporting the change management process toward a digitalized tax and customs organization.
Increasing company-wide visibility of the digitalization function


Main Tasks:


Perform detailed exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Conduct ad hoc analyses to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
Utilize statistical techniques to interpret data and provide actionable recommendations.
Work with large datasets to extract, clean, and prepare data for analysis
Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, or similar.
Develop and design data visualizations that effectively communicate insights and findings.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into visual solutions.
Ensure visualizations are user-friendly and accessible to non-technical stakeholders and follow the governance standards
Generate regular and ad hoc reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
Develop and maintain documentation for data analysis processes and methodologies
Work closely with cross-functional teams, to ensure data solutions align with business objectives.
Provide training and support to team members and stakeholders on using data visualizations and reports.


Qualifications


Completed (applied) university degree in Business Informatics, Business Administration, or a comparable qualification.
Several years of professional experience in IT or financial functions, ideally in an interface role between tax and IT.
Basic knowledge or project experience in tax and customs law is desirable.
Process knowledge and understanding in the financial sector, particularly capturing current and target processes, analyzing them, and deriving digitalization opportunities.
Experience as a project manager, e.g., in the implementation of new systems.
Experience in international projects and working in international teams.
Expertise in SAP R/3 or SAP S/4HANA
Knowledge of data analytics software such as KNIME, R-Studio, or Power BI.
Knowledge of low-code/no-code platforms such as Mendix or PowerApps.
Fluent in English, German is an advantage.
Willingness and ability to work in an international and multicultural environment.
Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
High level of commitment and assertiveness.
Customer orientation and stakeholder management.
Excellent communication and presentation skills;
Experience in project and process management, ideally in the field of digital transformation
Team-oriented working style.


Additional Information

The well-being of our employees is important to us. That's why we offer exciting career prospects and support you in achieving a good work-life balance with additional benefits such as:


Training opportunities
Mobile and flexible working models
Sabbaticals
and much more...


If you meet the requirements, you will be contacted within 15 days.

We are committed to fostering a workplace where everyone feels safe, respected, and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates regardless of age, gender, nationality, cultural background, disability, religion, ideology or sexual orientation.

Sounds interesting for you? Click here to find out more.

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

  • Identifying digitalization potential to create synergies and increase efficiency.
  • Conducting software-based data analyses of complex business data (SAP data, customs data, external data, etc.).
  • Developing digital solutions using low-code and no-code platforms (PowerApps & Mendix).
  • Creating concepts, initiating, and leading national and international digitalization projects.
  • Monitoring and managing the allocated project budget.
  • Supporting the change management process toward a digitalized tax and customs organization.
  • Increasing company-wide visibility of the digitalization function

Main Tasks:

  • Perform detailed exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
  • Conduct ad hoc analyses to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
  • Utilize statistical techniques to interpret data and provide actionable recommendations.
  • Work with large datasets to extract, clean, and prepare data for analysis
  • Create interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, or similar.
  • Develop and design data visualizations that effectively communicate insights and findings.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into visual solutions.
  • Ensure visualizations are user-friendly and accessible to non-technical stakeholders and follow the governance standards
  • Generate regular and ad hoc reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs) and business metrics.
  • Develop and maintain documentation for data analysis processes and methodologies
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams, to ensure data solutions align with business objectives.
  • Provide training and support to team members and stakeholders on using data visualizations and reports.

Qualifications

  • Completed (applied) university degree in Business Informatics, Business Administration, or a comparable qualification.
  • Several years of professional experience in IT or financial functions, ideally in an interface role between tax and IT.
  • Basic knowledge or project experience in tax and customs law is desirable.
  • Process knowledge and understanding in the financial sector, particularly capturing current and target processes, analyzing them, and deriving digitalization opportunities.
  • Experience as a project manager, e.g., in the implementation of new systems.
  • Experience in international projects and working in international teams.
  • Expertise in SAP R/3 or SAP S/4HANA
  • Knowledge of data analytics software such as KNIME, R-Studio, or Power BI.
  • Knowledge of low-code/no-code platforms such as Mendix or PowerApps.
  • Fluent in English, German is an advantage.
  • Willingness and ability to work in an international and multicultural environment.
  • Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
  • High level of commitment and assertiveness.
  • Customer orientation and stakeholder management.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills;
  • Experience in project and process management, ideally in the field of digital transformation
  • Team-oriented working style.

Additional Information

The well-being of our employees is important to us. That's why we offer exciting career prospects and support you in achieving a good work-life balance with additional benefits such as:

  • Training opportunities
  • Mobile and flexible working models
  • Sabbaticals
  • and much more...

If you meet the requirements, you will be contacted within 15 days.

We are committed to fostering a workplace where everyone feels safe, respected, and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates regardless of age, gender, nationality, cultural background, disability, religion, ideology or sexual orientation.

Sounds interesting for you? Click here to find out more.

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

Sobre a Deloitte

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîé We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx)




MAIN TASKS:




Work closely with business users to understand their requirements and solve business problems.
Translate business requirements into Alteryx workflows, collaborating with local and remote IT teams to process and make data available to users.
Develop workflows according to IT software development governance rules.
Analyze, estimate, and define tasks necessary to deliver data projects.
Maintain and evolve assets created during the projects.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Experience: 4+ years in data preparation and data reconciliation.

Technical Skills:

Strong experience with Alteryx (2+ years).
Proficient in SQL.
Experience with VBA.
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a similar field.

Communication & Soft Skills:

Good communication skills.
Proactive and able to work autonomously.
Strong interest in learning, improving processes, and helping others.
Ability to collaborate effectively within a team and across locations.
Languages: Proficient in English.
Nice to have: Power BI experience, experience in the financial industry, knowledge of agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban), and French language skills.




üìçHybrid Role in Porto!




üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
üìå We're Hiring: Senior Data Analyst | Porto (Hybrid)




Are you ready to take part in data-driven transformation within the Corporate & Investment Banking world? Join us as a Senior Data Analyst to support a major client on key finance and data management initiatives.




üîç About the role

You will play a central role in improving data quality, reporting capabilities, and analytical frameworks that support decision-making across finance departments. Working closely with both business and IT teams, you‚Äôll help ensure that data is accurate, accessible, and used to its fullest potential.




üéØ What you‚Äôll do:

Analyze, clean, and structure data to support finance operations
Build and maintain BI dashboards and reports (Power BI, Tableau)
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify needs and propose automation solutions
Apply statistical models and advanced data techniques
Support IT-led initiatives by contributing to data architecture and governance
Promote best practices in data visualization and reporting




üìö Key Projects:

Financial data quality & integrity optimization
Cross-team data reporting improvements
Automation and visualization of finance indicators
Support regulatory and internal audit requirements through data




üîß Technical Skills:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst in the banking sector, ideally within CIB
Proficiency with Power BI, Tableau, SQL, DAX, M, and Python
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data manipulation, and predictive analysis
Experience working on IT/data projects in a complex environment




üåê Language Skills:

Fluency in English (mandatory)
Other languages are a plus




üí° Soft Skills:

Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail
Excellent communication skills across business and technical teams
Ability to formalize complex subjects clearly and concisely
Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced setting




üåç Why join us?

Be part of a dynamic, multicultural team driving innovation and compliance
Work on impactful, large-scale transformation initiatives
Hybrid work model with a focus on work-life balance
Opportunities for growth within an international organization




If you're passionate about data, eager to work in a financial environment, and ready to take on a new challenge in Porto, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Finance Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.




DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;




DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;




DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.




Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.




We are looking for an Finance Data Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Analyse and interpret financial data focusing on IFRS13.
Developing analytical models for Position, PnL and Mark to Market, valuation etc.
Build and maintain financial data transformation & reports and dashboards for internal stakeholders.
Maintain finance master data governance model. ¬∑ Ensure data accuracy and support automation of recurring reporting tasks.




Requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. ¬∑ 1‚Äì3 years of experience in financial or data analysis.
Working knowledge of IFRS 13 and financial instrument valuation. ¬∑ Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
Advanced Excel (formulas, pivot tables, Power Query).
SQL for querying and managing financial datasets. ¬∑ Basic knowledge of AI models related to Finance is a Plus.
Power BI or Qlik sense or Open source (Apache Superset..) for data visualization and reporting.
Familiarity with financial systems or market data platforms (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters) is a plus
Proficiency in English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/FinanceDataAnalyst‚Äù.




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar‚Äôs BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company‚Äôs business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team‚Äôs existing BI assets.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team‚Äôs efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team‚Äôs efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.


The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.


What‚Äôs In It For You


Flexible hybrid working
Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more
HTML:
We‚Äôre the world‚Äôs leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Our Functions teams are right at the centre of our business, making sure we can always get better, every day. Supporting the business with things like Marketing, Human Resources, Finance, Legal and Technology, our Functions colleagues are skilled professionals whose role it is to ensure we continue to become an indispensable partner to brands everywhere.

Job Details

About the BI Team: The Kantar BI team is a dynamic, integrated function that delivers expert data tools and insights to Finance across Kantar. Our primary focus is to empower business teams with seamless access to high-quality data while managing best-in-class business intelligence solutions. By enhancing data quality and streamlining BI processes, we drive operational excellence and elevate the overall business experience.

Why this job is important

As a Business Intelligence Analyst within Kantar‚Äôs BI team, you will play a key role in executing and supporting the company‚Äôs business intelligence strategy. Reporting directly to the BI Manager, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality reporting, analytics, and data-driven insights that align with strategic objectives. Your contributions will help transform raw data into valuable business intelligence, whether through reports, analyses, or by enhancing the team‚Äôs existing BI assets.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Project Ownership: Take charge of assigned projects, ensuring alignment with team priorities and strategic goals. Oversee the entire delivery process from inception to completion, adhering to deadlines and maintaining quality standards.
  • Data Analysis & Reporting: Create and sustain strategic dashboards, offering data-driven insights regarding performance across all financial dimensions.
  • Stakeholder Management: Manage stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure deliverables meet stakeholder requirements.
  • Advanced Analytics Support: Facilitate the application of advanced analytics models, such as forecasting, collaborating with the BI Manager to ensure new models are seamlessly incorporated into existing systems and processes.
  • Continuous Improvement: Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives by identifying areas for process optimization and innovation. Support the team‚Äôs efforts to enhance reporting and analytics capabilities by facilitating automation of reporting with BI Tools.
  • Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with all team members to ensure effective collaboration. Communicate effectively to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
  • Training & Education: Participate in training and education programs to enhance your BI skills and knowledge. Support the broader team‚Äôs efforts to promote a data-driven culture within the organisation.

The Skills & Experience Needed As Business Intelligence Analyst

  • Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business administration, engineering, data science, computer science, or a related field.
  • Experience: Previous experience in a business intelligence, data analysis, or similar role.
  • Technical Skills: Proficiency in BI tools (such as Power BI, Tableau, or MicroStrategy), data analysis techniques, and proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with ERP Reporting Platforms (Maconomy, SAP, Oracle) is a plus.
  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
  • Task Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with team priorities.
  • Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to engage effectively with senior stakeholders.
  • Problem-Solving: A proactive approach to problem-solving, with the ability to identify challenges and develop effective solutions.
  • Collaboration: A team player with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional environment.

What‚Äôs In It For You

  • Flexible hybrid working
  • Up to 25 days off, plus your birthday off and two days paid for volunteering
  • Meal card and flexible benefits where you are allocated funds to spend on a variety of benefits such as transport cost, education related and more

Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We‚Äôre dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you‚Äôre not an exact match, we‚Äôd love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are searching for an Data & Reporting Analyst!




Requirements:

Academic degree in IT, Cybersecurity, or other relevant area for the position.
Very good professional practice of English (French is a plus).
At least 5 years of professional experience in data analysis.
Very good Expertise in Excel, Python and other ETL tools.
Expertise in Power Bi is mandatory.
Ability to be autonomous.
Commitment to the job and the team objectives.
Systematic, critical, and logical thinking.
Be committed, demanding and pedagogue.
Strive continuously for customer satisfaction.
Aim to deliver very high-quality results.
Respect the procedures, methodologies, and directives.
Good capability of managing stress and conflicts.
Good listening and questioning ability.
Ability to plan work ahead and to prioritize workload.
Good team working ability.
Rigorous.
Client oriented.
Collaborative working skills.
Adaptation capacity.
Analytical skills.
Very Good level of english.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV in to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/Data&Reporting‚Äù.




Thank You!




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Quantitative Data & BI Specialist - Tableau
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.







üîéWe are looking for a Quantitative Data & BI Specialist - Tableau




MAIN TASKS:

Data Visualization:

Design and develop interactive Tableau dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights.
Ensure dashboards are user-friendly, visually appealing, and aligned with business requirements.

Data Management:

Collaborate with data engineers and analysts to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and availability.
Work with large datasets, perform data cleansing, and optimize data queries for performance.

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Engage with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that meet their objectives.
Conduct training sessions and workshops to educate users on how to effectively use Tableau dashboards.

Maintenance and Support:

Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Tableau dashboards and reports.
Continuously monitor and improve the performance of existing dashboards.

Documentation:

Maintain detailed documentation of all dashboards, reports, and data sources.

Keep up to date with the latest Tableau features and best practices.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Academic background in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field.
Professional experience as a Tableau Developer (at least 2 years).




Technical Skills:

Proficiency in Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server.
Strong SQL skills and experience with databases (e.g., MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).
Familiarity with data warehousing concepts and ETL processes.
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Knowledge of other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikView) is a plus.

Analytical Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to interpret complex data and translate it into meaningful insights.

Communication Skills:

Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Fluency in written and spoken English.

Other Skills:

Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize multiple projects and meet deadlines
Familiarity with agile methodologies and project management tools.
Knowledge in financial markets is a plus (fx, credit, rates, commodities).
Hybrid role based in Porto or Lisbon







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Traded Risk Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The mission of RISK Market & Financial Institutions (‚ÄúRISK MFI‚Äù) is to provide the Senior Management of the Group, of the RISK Function and of Global Markets (‚ÄúGM‚Äù) and of Securities and Services with full transparency and dynamic analysis and monitoring of market, counterparty, valuation and liquidity risks originated and managed by CIB and of credit risks on Financial Institutions in order to assist them in their risk decision making and monitoring.

The Digital team within RISK MFI review processes and develops light IT solutions to automate the many risk management processes and analysis dashboards of the RISK MFI department.

Each project is undertaken in a predefined environment and withing specific guidelines built in coordination with the RISK IT department.

There is a strong focus in improving the user experience and exploiting efficiently and timely the vast amount of available data.

An understanding of the risk management purpose behind those processes is therefore key.

Past projects have focused on automation of processes in Python, app development with interactive visualisations, BOT development, APIs, etc.

The role encompasses the maintenance and support of existing tools, taking the lead on new developments, the close collaboration with the risk managers to shape an efficient visualisation of the data and related workflow of decisions.

The Digital team works in close collaboration with the RISK IT department, making sure best coding practices are followed. It allows for a smooth the path to production of the tools developed by the team. For many projects, the Digital team directly codes in the official production systems under the guidance of RISK IT colleagues.

The team uses a variety of technologies but specialises in Python, with some exposure to HTML, CSS, JavaScript, etc.

The team is based in London, Lisbon and Porto and operates following Agile principles . The team works alongside around 500 people focusing on Market, Counterparty and Liquidity risk topics.

Your Main Activities Are


Inquisitive with a strong willingness to understand financial risk management, with a strong attention to detail.
Ability to gather, integrate, process and simplify large amounts of information
Ability to ensure the relevancy of the work done, the correct presentation of details and the full accomplishment of tasks
Value and integrate client's feedback to improve products, services and processes.
Aims at increasing client satisfaction and anticipating their needs.
Ability to anticipate and takes initiative to answer a particular situation, to learn from experiences and to deploy curiosity about topics outside their immediate scope.
Ability to manage time, to plan, structure, prioritise and coordinate activities and resources effectively to reach objectives.


Profile And Skills To Success


A strong appetite to working in the financial industry and understanding of financial risk management,
An experience related to financial markets and risk management is an advantage
Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Mathematics, Science or Engineering.
2 to 5 years of working experience in a relevant data analysis field.
On programming skills, a solid working knowledge of Python is required, with a strong understanding of numpy, pandas, etc


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
A Company you will be happy to grow with!

At InnoTech, it‚Äôs all about connecting people with business through technology.

We care about you, your happiness, and your well-being. We seek passionate individuals eager to learn and improve their skills with us ‚Äì growth is in our DNA. This dedication has earned us recognition as a Best Workplace in Portugal for 2023 and 2024. Furthermore, in 2024, we were proudly acknowledged as one of the top IT companies to work for in Portugal, receiving the Best Workplace award in the IT sector, given by Great Place to Work.

For us, sustainability is not just a word. Integrity and social responsibility lead our behavior.

We dare to be different, ambitious, dream big, and deliver value like no other! You can work with top-level partners in banking, insurance, retail, telecommunications, financial services, and more!

Join our team of 180+ InnoTechers and bring your talent as a Data Analyst.

Your Mission Will Be


Collaborate with stakeholders across various sectors to identify and understand their analytical needs and challenges;
Map business requirements to existing analytics product functionality, identifying opportunities for enhancement and customization;
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI, ensuring they deliver actionable insights;
Ensure the quality and integrity of the data used for analysis.


You Will Need


Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
Proven proficiency in the Power BI tool, including development of dashboards and reports;
Experience working with Snowflake and Azure Databricks;
Fluency in Portuguese and English;
CPLP nationality or an EU work permit is required to facilitate employment.


Would Be Awesome If You Have


BSc or MSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, or related fields;
Experience working with SQL Server.


With Us You Can Be a


TechThinker ‚Äì people who want to re-imagine technology with us
TechSolver ‚Äì strategic, resilient, and a little bit of a puzzle lover
InnoMinder ‚Äì inhale innovation, exhale digital transformation
InnoTecher ‚Äì no words needed. Just happiness, talent, and all the above!


Are you convinced? Come see it for yourself.

Join our Top-Notch Team!

Title: Business Intelligence Associate

Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Design visually appealing and business useful reports.
Understand client requirement and suggest right technical architecture.
Developing technically efficient, fast, useful and appealing reports.
Technical problem solving - good knowledge of DAX and data modelling.
Preparing and facilitating workshops.
Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives.



What you‚Äôll bring


3+ years of experience in PowerBI/ BI design and development.
Prior experience in customer facing role across functions is good to have.
In-depth understand of data modelling and basics of azure environment.
Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.
